Reviews.Content: So I was in town for my best friends bachelorette party/. We decided to stay at the Indigo because it was centrally located to everything we wanted. The hotel was absolutely stunning! Our rooms were comfortable (the beds, linens, towels are FANTASTIC), and very clean. The staff and customer service was impeccable. Upon check-in we met Dieter. He was super helpful, hilarious, and he went out of his way to make sure we had a fantastic weekend. He even sent champagne up to our room to kick off our weekend celebration. He truely made our experience at the Indigo phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Downtown Culture and Nightlife.. 5 minute drive to the beaches”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaEddie1982
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute as part of my Vacation to San Diego, CA.. never having been before. They are 100% pet friendly and my dog was very comfortable staying here. Dogs are allowed in EVERY part of the hotel including the bar and restaurant area. I booked a King City View Room and requested a high floor for $135.00 a night. Upon arrival the valet was exceptionally friendly, they were very professional and really went above and beyond my expectations. Upon check in i was greeted by a front desk employee.. don't remember his name, i think it was Deider, anyway he was VERY UNPLEASANT. He didn't say hello, didn't give me any information about the hotel, or anything in the surrounding area, didn't tell me that there would be a $75.00 AUTHORIZATION HOLD on my credit card for incidentals , and he didn't really seem to throw a smile or be happy to have a job, or even be alive for that matter. He was kind of rude and just bitter as he handed me my hotel keys and credit card back. (Seriously if you hate your job that much and are in a bad mood, there are plenty of other people who are up beat and have a personality who can do his job 100 times better) anyway, we checked in and to my surprise was on the 11th floor. I thought the hotel only had 9 levels so this was a surprise (they have 12). The room was exceptional, very spacious, very clean, very modern, and overall A+. As part of bringing a dog to the hotel they offer a ruff life package according to their website where a dog bowl, and dog bed are provided. This was not so I called the front desk and got the same jerk who checked me in and he never followed up with me, it took an hour to get a dog bowl. Anyway on a positive note - EVERYTHING about this hotel is great, all the staff was very nice and friendly (other than the first guy). Housekeeping was a bit on the poor side, it took 1/2 hour to get towels, 1/2 hour to get anything and I had to request maid service. I mentioned this to the front desk upon checkout and to my surprise for the inconvenience they credited me $35.00 (one day) toward the valet parking. I recommend the Valet, it is $35.00 per night but totally worth it, yes there are other lots on the street for $10-$15 less, but they go unmanned at night and anything can happen. This hotel is literally within walking distance to 5th Avenue and Market St. which all the nightlife is on, there are a ton of bars, restaurants, hookah lounges, cigar lounges, coffee shops and so much culture and is very exciting and ALIVE during the day and after 5pm. It is a very quick 10 minute drive to Ocean Beach (Dog Friendly Off Leash Beach), Sea World and other beaches in the area. The hotel is also one block away from PetCo field where the Padres play, and you can get a great view of the game from the Hotel's 9th Level Rooftop Bar for free. The area south to the hotel (East of 11th Avenue) known as "the east village" is kind of sketchy, but it looks as the neighborhood is upcoming. Overall, I'd stay here again, they took care of my problems and always greeted me when i returned back to the hotel with a smile and a hello...even at 2AM. Even the Valet remembered where i was going and asked me how was the beach, how was the bar etc. If you are looking for a good walking distance to all the nightlife and culture, this modern hotel is definitely the place. On my last night there, i was surprised to find in my room under my door an invitation to stay an extra night at $99.00. This is something I have never seen before anywhere else and if I had the extra time to spare i should would have taken them up on their offer as I could have used another day in San Diego. Excellent Customer Service other than the jerk who checked me in at the beginning. I am happy that my overall experience was redeemed by everyone else and his attitude at the beginning didn't leave me with a negative impression of hotel and it's service. I highly recommend this hotel, and highly recommend you utilize the valet service. Book in advance for a good rate and it is worth the extra money for the City View Room.

Reviews.Title: “Super Place -- One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: ronrich1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on business many times and just love this hotel. Location is awesome + super cool terrace and bar at the top overlooking ballpark. My only complaint, I suppose, would be the $38/night for parking. Seems high, but other than that, you cannot go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - In desperate need of Customer Training”
Reviews.Author: dukefan2331
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at any Hotel Indigo, and our first place in San Diego that was not the Westin Gaslamp Quarter (a personal favorite). We stayed because my wife had earned free night through an ICH promotion that expired at the end of the month. The rooms themselves were nice. The terrace that overlooked Petco Park - divine (Padres were on the road during our stay). The workout room was great - and for the Californiat types, there was even a Meditation Terrace. I have ZERO issues with the accomodations. The staff? Pretty much every interaction was a negative one. It wasn't like they were rude - they just appeared to be undermotivated and rules bound. Issue #1 - Check in. My wife is a very frequent ICH guest, on her way to Platinum status this year. We also aren't partying youngsters, so we find that being on the "Elite" floors keeps the wilder partiers away. So we asked for elite floor and was told they didn't have one (which is hard to believe given the size). To make matters worse, they put us in a room where there was a door between the rooms - which vibrates sound from the room next door. And of course, the wild partiers ended up next door. We called security, but much sleep was lost. Issue #2 - The next morning we went to the front desk and asked about our neighbors - were they checking out, would they fill that room that night etc. All kinds of unclear answers. Finally we just asked to be moved (this was at 7:45am) but mentioned we had a critical place we needed to cab to by 8am. Could we leave our stuff in the room, and change rooms at 1pm? Nope. They made us pack up and get out right there. So of course we miss our 8am meeting time. Aren't hotels supposed to make things more convenient? For the record, the room they moved us to had no door to the adjoining room - an improvement. But another very, very loud floor with doors slamming all night long. Issue #3 - We were on the terrace Saturday with a great bottle of wine, enjoying the weather. The bartender saw us come on with both the wine and our glasses and said nothing to us. So we made plans to do the same on Sunday. We stepped out with a beer and were having a great conversation with some fellow Texans. Suddenly out of nowhere an employee appears and tells us all to leave - that outside beverages weren't allowed on the terrace. When I tell him that they were allowed yesterday, even blessed by the bartender, he said the bartender "was new" and didn't know what he was talking about. Huh?!?!? I later learned (see Issue #4) that "new" seems to be the term tossed around for all customer errors made at the Indigo. The sad part was that we would have stayed on the terrace and talked - but the guy was so abrupt - and of course, even in late afternoon, the terrace bar was not yet open. So we were pretty much forced to leave. Truly wished I have gotten that jerk's name. Issue #4 - Upon returning home I see a significant charge on my credit card. Despite staying on free nights, we were charged as if they had never seen the freecertificates. The Front Desk Manager, Darin (one guy who has excellent customer skills, btw) said he would issue a refund. We haven't seen it yet, so let's hope we don't need to escalate this. Again the reason for failure? The person checking us in "was new" and messed up. Bottom line: Great, great property. Nice location with places off the Gaslamp Quarter that are less touristy (don't miss The Mission for coffee and breakfast, The Neighborhood for lunch and beers). Hotel a bit noisy - and no matter how hard we tried (we'd be the ones waking YOU up at 6am) the doors shut very loud. Service needs a tuning up - asking to be in a quiet place, having a drink where you are allowed one day and denied the next, getting your bill right. We weren't asking for much. And sadly we got nothing but let down. I keep the rating at average because in the end it is a very nice property and location.

Reviews.Title: “Personalized attention in a remarkable setting.”
Reviews.Author: Lquirk13
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Indigo exceeds the expectations of travel goers. A fun and captivating modern atmosphere exists throughout the hotel. From a heavenly bed to a chic bar overlooking Petco Park, this hotel is sure to please all, including guests' four legged friends. My fiancÃ© and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else! One particular individual, a bartender named William, who works there made our trip especially memorable by providing individualized attention combined with a friendly attitude to everyone in our group. After the experience he provided us with, we look forward to returning to the Hotel Indigo!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ez311
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Hotel Indigo was great. As a Platinum member, I was upgraded to a very large corner suite with a fantastic view of the stadium. The suite was located one floor above the outside open bar area, so I was concerned about noise levels late at night. To my surprise, there were no problems with noise at all and we slept great. The location is a short walking distance from a number of restaurants and a short walk to the trolley stop as well. The only negatives I have are the lack of a swimming pool and expensive parking. If I return to San Diego, the Hotel Indigo will be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “The Best & Most Sincere Customer Service ever...”
Reviews.Author: Jojobianchi
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel for a work meetng that was being held at the hotel. The 2 Front Desk Associates could not have been nicer. They explained where my room was, where the meeting was and a brief run down of the hotel. I later came back and asked for a great spot for a Sea Food Dinner. Not only did they recommend a fabulous nearby restaurant, they gave me a voucher for a complimentary appetizer and called ahead to confirm my reservation. As I arrived at the restaurant, they were already waiting for me. What a great feeling. The Associates went out of their way and sincerely meant it. What a fabulous hotel for business or pleasure. After dinner I went to the 9th floor and worked out in their fabulous fitness room and then enjoyed a glass on wine on the 9th floors outdoor bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel experience I have ever had....”
Reviews.Author: j0j0dancer199
Reviews.Content: Exceptional people made and extra exceptional stay. Beautiful surrounds with extra service from Ellen, Deiter,David,Chris,Tioga-restaurant,Sergio-bell person,Payton, Michael-restaurantand I am sure there were many more who's names I did not get. EVERYONE WAS COURTIOUS,FRIENDLY AND VERY WELCOMING.....It definitely was THE BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCE i HAVE EVER HAD. We all look forward to coming back soon.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service is Still Alive and Well.”
Reviews.Author: Vegas4034
Reviews.Content: Being in the hospitality industry for many years, I'm pleasently surprised when I have such a consistant experience with the entire staff of such a boutique hotel. These type of properties usually offer an "experience" that rarely delivers on the promiss. I have to say that the Hotel Indigo San Diego has hit a home run with their personal attention to details. The staff made me feel like I was in a 5 star resort. Everything from the valet greeting by name to the front desk agent remembering that I mentioned my love for baseball to the attention to detail from the housekeeping staff. This is my second visit to the hotel and I plan on coming back again and again. Well done Hotel Indigo!

Reviews.Title: “FAB U LOUS”
Reviews.Author: Star112863
Reviews.Content: Love love love this hotel..... Wow, where do I start..... Location, excellent, decor, out of this world stunning, rooms, to die for.... 9th floor bar, overlooks Petco field, where we drank wine and watched the Padrea's game. I can tell you this, Ihave traveled and stayed at many hotels, this one has to be one of my very favorite hotels ever..... I hope you try this hotel and enjoy it as much as we did!! Happy and Safe traveles!!!

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeff1432
Reviews.Content: This was hands down the best stay I have had in a very long time! Kudos especially go out to Peyton at the front desk. Great customer service. The room was fantastic, with a great view of the Padres baseball field. The terrace on the 9th floor was a great place for all of us to hang out and unwind. And the Internet was free!!!!! I have stayed in a lot of hotels in that area and the Hotel Indigo hands down is the best all around!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience in Every Department”
Reviews.Author: mmcfamily
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I were traveling on business. The front desk agents were top of the line and went above and beyond my personal expectation. The rooms were spacious, clean, nicely decorated and I Love your Aveda Products. The fitness room had a beautiful view and we loved the terrace. It was my first time staying at Hotel Indigo and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with exceptional staff...”
Reviews.Author: Goldilocks12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last week and overall had a great experience. When we arrived at Hotel Indigo we were greeted by Ellen, a helpful and friendly front desk employee. We were upgraded to a suite but when we arrived in the room there were a few issues that became somewhat of a hassle to get resolved. First off, I went to take a shower & the water temperature was basically luke warm. The water temp was rectified after one phone call to the front desk. We came back after a quick walk through the gaslamp quarter and found that the problem with our shower was fixed but now the toilet wouldn't flush, again with the phone call to the front desk & another maintenance visit. With all that said, everyone was extremely helpful and understanding about how frustrated we were & they did everything in their power to correct the problem. From then on we had a fantastic stay in a beautiful room with great staff. The happy hour on the rooftop bar was great and Adriana in hotel lobby bar was friendly and warm. We will definitely be back even though our stay started off rocky because the staff made up for all the initial inconveniences. Thank you guys for really making our trip special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--just don't eat the breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: SANTravelers
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel choice if you are are either an out of towner or nearby resident coming to San Diego to go to Petco Park for a baseball game (why we stayed here--we live 25 miles north of the city but decided to make a weekend getaway out of going to the night game) or going to the Gaslamp District (really the only restaurant and club area of San Diego). It's a bit further from the Harbor activities but not an impossible walk. The rooms are very nicely done --larger than most hotels at that price range--modern, restful decor both in the rooms and the lobby; clean. We were on the 6th floor but it was somewhat noisy down on the street at least until 2am but then you are in the middle of an entertainment area in a big city so to be expected. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from both Petco and it's on the edge of Gaslamp. The service throughout the hotel, with one exception, is excellent. Check in and out is great (special commendation to Darren the desk manager who was particularly nice, as was the other lady at the front desk when we left). My wife left her purse in the bar the night before we left, and we didn't notice it until the next morning. She called down and it was delivered to our room immediately. So the hotel in general is a very good value and very pleasant. The one exception on service and value is the breakfast restaurant (near the bar). First, there is very limited choice on eggs--scrambled, scrambled, or scrambled in various forms. No choice. Second . We came down for bkfst within the specified serving times on a Sunday morning. No one was there to seat us, so we just sat down at a table. There were 4 waiters and maybe 8 tables filled so it wasn't very busy or full. We waited 10 minutes for service and then it wasn't the waiter who came over to take our order but the great Darren who from the front desk noticed we had not gotten served and took it upon himself to come over and take our order. On the way out same thing happened--we asked for the check and waited. And waited. One waiter passed our table and indicated it was coming. It didn't. We don't know what the restaurant manager was doing at the bar but he wasn't getting our check. Finally 10 minutes after we asked for it, we looked over and even he had disappeared as had all the other waiters! So we just got up, left and told Darren at the front desk what we were doing and to just add any charges to our bill b/c we were tired of waiting. They did. And when I told the other lady at the desk on check out what happened, she very nicely did the right thing and as compensation took our bar bill from the last night off the final bill. So we highly recommend this hotel to stay at--excellent value and service. Just don't eat breakfast at the hotel and you'll really like it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, modern, and relaxing place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kscartac
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here and could not have been more pleased! The rooms were stunning and the service was great! Dieter took amazing care of us and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great, pet-friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: namartin14
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel staffed w/very friendly, helpful people, for a pet-friendly hotel, it is extremely clean and tastefully designed. There's a lounge/bar on the 9th floor with great views of the city and also has a huge, grassy area for your pets. From what I researched of the hotels in the area it seemed to be the nicest hotel that catered to pet-loving people. Now I can say unequivocally that my research was correct!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: rosestems
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Indigo is an awesome place to stay. Not to mention that they are a pet friendly hotel as well. The staff is exceptionally nice and very helpful. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking to stay in the Gas Lamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff, perfect location. Returning here = YES!”
Reviews.Author: gilkesjm
Reviews.Content: Great location and wonderfully organized rooms. Everything required for a great business trip. Great coffee, great spa style bathrooms and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you want to go to a Padres Game”
Reviews.Author: RazorbacksFan
Reviews.Content: I used rewards points to stay here 3 nights over a weekend. I was given a corner room on the 7th floor with a great view of Petco Park. The front desk staff was very friendly and greeted us everytime we entered the hotel. We didn't bring our dog, but this would be an excellent place to do so. There aren't a lot of grassy areas in the urban surroundings to take your dog for a pottie break. However, you don't even need to leave the hotel for this, as the 9th floor outdoor area has a grassy pet relief area. The 9th floor also has a workout area with several ellptical machines, treadmills, and a stationary bike. There is even a private meditation deck. The rooms are nicely appointed. The free wifi was very fast every time I used it. There is only 1 small draw back to the hardwood floors, it can be a little noisy if someone in high heel shoes walks around in the room above you. I discovered this one morning at 6 AM, but quickly returned to back to sleep. Parking is a little on the high side, but since I got the room for free it was easier to overlook. Plus we went to a Padres game one night so we just walked from the hotel and didn't have to pay to park at the stadium. The valet staff was friendly and always had our car out front in a matter of minutes. Its a short and easy drive to the harbor and zoo from the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants within easy walking distances of the hotel in the gaslamp district. If you are looking for a good breakfast option, I'd recommend Cafe 222. You can even walk to the harbor area if you aren't opposed to a 20 minute or so walk. We felt very safe doing so. All in all this is a very nice place to stay in the gaslamp district. I was very plesaed with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiBoo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times for work over the last 7 months. LOVE the Hotel & Staff!! They always make you feel welcome and go out of the way to meet your needs. One staff member in particular stands out. His name is Will Gagan. He always greets me by name and ALWAYS has a smile and a cheerful attitude. Hotel Indigo is very lucky to have him as a member of their GREAT TEAM. It feels like going home, when i stay there!! Keep up the GREAT JOB!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The front desk personel makes you feel like home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: klee888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel indigo in San Diego for 13 nights during our company new store build. My co-workers ( 6 total) and I always enjoy the friendly smile and greet starting from the front door to the hotel lobby front desk. The service is outstanding, the food is above other hotels. My peers are the most demanding bunch since we are always on the road for work. We all have stayed at a hundreds of hotels, and we rate this hotel on the top of our list. We are all priority gold or platinum members, so we know what service is all about. The entire staff is great, but I would like to give an extra thanks to Ellen, where she works at the front desk. Every time we return from our long day of work, she greets us with a sincere smile and ask if our day went great. She ask if she can help us with dinner plans and other activities we are interested in. At the end of a long day of work, not one of us wants to smile, but somehow Ellen brings a smile to us and everyone she greets. Great hotel and service!!

Reviews.Title: “Look nowhere else; stay here!”
Reviews.Author: english_731
Reviews.Content: This place has everything I want in a hotel; nice clean rooms, friendly & helpful staff, free wifi, great vibe, great location. It's new and feels very stylish and funky; if you like 'classic' hotels you may not like this, but for me and my wife it was great. Yes it's not got all the bells and whistles of a 5-star big chain hotel, but personally I dont need or want that. When they knew we were on honeymoon we got a personal card and some champagne. It has an excellent roof bar where we met other friendly guests and also some locals who also go there sometimes for a 'dog meetup' night- definitely check it out. Rooms are fantastic; a small issue meant we had to change rooms but this was dealt with efficiently and ended up in one with an awesome view over the Padre's baseball ground. All rooms are clean, pretty spacious and airy and very stylish with equally nice bathrooms. Special thanks to Ellen on front desk, David (ask him for awesome eating recommendations), William at the bar and the concierge guys who helped make this a pleasant stay in San Diego. We look forward to our next time in town!

Reviews.Title: “A true GEM - would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: amyczar8
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a friend, checking out the San Diego area for a potential move to the west coast (from the Boston area originally) and was truly pleased by the Hotel Indigo and all it's staff. The valet service was prompt (but pricey at $35 a day) and friendly - and the moment you walk into the lobby you are greeted with a smile by one of the many staff members there to assist you. The lobby also has a great aroma-therapy-esque smell that was such a pleasure to walk into every day. The decor of the rooms and hotel common areas was tasteful and trendy. The hotel is impeccably clean - not a single thing was out of order while we were there. The beds in our room were extremely comfortable, not to mention our room was cleaned/freshened up every day, without it being a burden or distraction. While my friend and I didn't have our dogs with us, it was such a pleasure to see a hotel that is truly "pet friendly" - offering water dishes inside and out, as well as a "dog cocktail hour" at the bar on the 9th floor, during our stay there. If you have a pet (or not), and want a fun, clean, friendly, safe stay in San Diego's popular Gaslamp Quarter - Hotel Indigo is THE BEST choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service! Talk to Melissa at front desk.”
Reviews.Author: cbadsurfr
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel room for my sisters 30th BDAY. Right from the beginning the staff had great customer service, however to help us further they asked if our stay was for a special event and I expressed it was for her 30 th BDAY. At no cost they up graded our room and asked if we wanted to bring any champagne in for them to place on ice for her arrival. Melissa at the front desk staff was the most helpful, however everyone was very friendly and helpful. The building is gorgeous and we enjoyed our stay greatly! We will absolutely come back.

Reviews.Title: “One block walk to Petco - worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: leighla319
Reviews.Content: The Indigo was a great experience. Clean clean room - spacious bathroom, comfy bedding, ample pillows and towels, aveda bath products, free wi-fi, Keurig (sp?) coffee and tea maker. A window that opened so we could take advantage of the cool San Diego breeze! We were on the 2nd floor right over the bar and lobby on a Saturday night and our room was very very quiet. I was a little bit worried that because our window overlooked the valet parking stand and we were right over the bar that I'd hear noise, but once we closed the door, it was super quiet. I can only assume the walls have lots and lots of insulation. I was also expecting noise because of the (beautiful) hard wood floors, but not a peep (or thud or click) from the room above us. We went to a game at Petco and walked one block to get into the stadium. We didn't eat in the restaurant, so can't comment on food quality. Staff was super friendly. The ONLY downside was the $35 valet parking fee. I live in Los Angeles, so expect to pay something, but I thought it was a bit overpriced. If you're planning on going to a game, you probably want to factor in the convenience factor. Petco Park charges $15 - so for another $20, you can walk to the park in one block. And then walk back to your room in under 3 minutes and not have to worry about getting your car out of the Petco lot and get back to your room. Is it worth it? Depends on your frugality factor. I had my teenage son with me, so I thought it was probably worth it. I'd definitely stay at the hotel again. Ã‡omfy comfy beds, and more towels than we used. I love that. If all hotels knew how much women appreciate abundant towels and cozy sheets, they could skimp on other stuff and make us happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Sellmatt
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 3 days. What a great experience! We ended up getting the deal on hotwire for a great rate and weren't sure what to expect. From the moment we walked in the valet staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful. Parking was $35 a night and the attendant patiently explained what other options there were, some for less money even. We ended up going with the hotel parking for the convienence (unlimited in and out). The attendant I delt with the most - I believe his name was Sergio - was fantastic and never seemed phased no matter how many people he had to help. Dave at the front desk was great. He remembered me by name after just one conversation and was always approachable if we needed something! The room was clean and visually appealing. The front desk staff even called up to our room to make sure things were ok. We asked if there was a drugstore nearby because we needed toothpaste and without hesitation they brought a tube up. Loved the 9th floor bar. On our last night Wlliam was the bartender and the service was amazing. He had a lot of people to deal with but somehow managed to make us feel like we were his only customers! Great customer service. Although we got the deal from hotwire and weren't sure what we would be getting, our expectations were exceeded. We will definitely be staying here again even if it ends up costing more than the original hotwire deal! I just can't get over how fantastic the experience was from the facilities to the customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern”
Reviews.Author: Kawhona
Reviews.Content: If you like elements,aloft,W or Hyatt place give it a try. Hotels aren't cheap in SD but this is reasonable and if you are in town to see a Padres game you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, down to the last detail.”
Reviews.Author: Roxalt
Reviews.Content: This is one fabulous hotel. From the wonderful staff, to the stylish design, to the Aveda bath products. This is a dream for those of us with asthma. This LEED certified hotel uses only environmentally -friendly products. Everything about this hotel is designed to put one at ease. The hotel is immaculate, the bedding divine, the food is yummy. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel w/great service in a desirable location.”
Reviews.Author: BarbsNC
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via Trip Advisor and it met our expectations. It is in a great location...the hotel overlooks Petco Park (unfortunately the Padres were not playing), it was w/in walking distance of the Gaslamp District and near the 5th Ave. Pier stop of the Ferry to Coronado Island. It had free Wifi, an awesome rooftop bar, pet friendly (although we didn't have one we enjoyed everyone else's pet at the rooftop bar), a great bartender who introduced us to a new drink (Moscow Mule) and they were very courtesy about luggage storage (we were on a red-eye flight). This is the best city ever!

Reviews.Title: “Need a hotel in San Diego, go to Hotel Indigo”
Reviews.Author: eascottesc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo is a wonderful place to stay. It is LEED Certified so as to maintain a minimal impact on our environment. But no corners were cut in luxury or service. Staff is extremely friendly and professional. Just steps from Petco Park and the San Diego Padres. Great restaurant and wonderful cocktails. I won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Sincerely Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: motjuste
Reviews.Content: Sleek and hip, the Hotel Indigo also offers the jaded business traveler something else: a warm and friendly staff who erase any memories of bloodless overbuilt corporate hotels or attitude-laden hipsterish boutique joints. Tastefully understated lobby. Beautiful rooms. Today, of course, it's all about the bed. I got lost in mine. A ninth-floor bar gives you a view of home plate at Petco Park. A prickly pear Margarita puts the icing on the cake. The hotel is pet friendly, so if you miss your dog, there are plenty of pooches to remind you of home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel especially for The Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: Lupinfairy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo welcomes you with a lovely fresh smell all the time in reception and the hallways. Our room was a very good size with 2 queen size beds. The room was very clean and had good amounts of coffee/tea provided. We were grateful for the fridge. The bathroom was a good size too and there was a big shower cubicle. There is a 10 minute walk to the Convention Centre which is safe and easy. There are plenty of restaurants within easy reach of the hotel and also it is only 3 blocks to the trolley stop.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, Great value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jem711
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a short 3 block walk to the trendy main street, and a bit more of a stroll to boutique shops and malls. It was immaculately clean, spacious and had a very comfortable breakfast/bar area located next to the lobby. a free internet computer station came in very handy when we had to book alternative transporation back to L.A. when our bus company cancelled our scheduled route. The room was very quiet - great for anyone that's a light sleeper! Well thought out interior decoration created a very relaxing atmosphere, very cosy and comfortable. Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel/bar in the city!”
Reviews.Author: ANGMOTS
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for work and was placed in Hotel Indigo. At first, when looking on the map and seeing where the hotel was located compared to the hotels that were closer to the convention center, I was worried it would be too far away. Now, after the stay is complete, I consider myself lucky!! First, this hotel is bright and cheery. The staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome and ensure you have everything you need to make your stay enjoyable. Same goes for the bar/restaurant, Table 509. The bartenders/servers Adriana, William, Ish- all fo them- make you feel welcome, take the time to listen to what you like and make the best drink recommendations based on what you offer up. Love that! Now, to compare this hotel to say, Hard Rock, near the convention center is almost unfair! It's literally like night and day. Also, any hotel near the convention center deals with the trolley and train ALL DAY and ALL NIGHT! I can't tell you how many of my colleagues had sleepless nights because of that alone! Other great things to note about Hotel Indigo are that it's pet-friendly (although I only saw dogs), they have great specials throughout the week, and the stadium (Petco Park) is just a block away! They do offer valet parking for $35 a day but there is street parking available some times, too, just beware you're on the right side due to street cleaning! (San Diego is so clean!) All in all- a wonderful spot. I was on the 10th floor- the room was spacious and cheery! The beds are super comfy (four pillows to each bed and they are soooo soft and fluffy!) They don't always get the shampoo/conditioner/coffee stocked consistently, but that can be fixed by making a simple call down to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor experience...”
Reviews.Author: CBridgeGirl
Reviews.Content: Checked in and room not clean (dirty rag on table and someone else's razor cap in shower)... Reported to front desk and room was to be recleaned... Came back hours later and room open/door not shut and my luggage was in there and room STILL NOT CLEAN -- same used razor cap in shower... Promised by front desk manager that room would be comp'd by hotel... Months later now and last phone call not returned and never received money back... I travel frequently and have not experienced service this poor....

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: Debra_TN
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to San Diego for two back-to-back conferences, staying a total of 10 nights. I'm SO glad I chose the Hotel Indigo - the staff and the accommodations turned what could have been a grueling business trip into an absolute pleasure. Darren, Kimberlee, David, and the rest of the team showed amazing hospitality and made me feel right at home. The restaurant staff was friendly and charming and the food was prompt and delicious. My room was impeccable, the bed comfortable, the wireless dependable - I wouldn't change a thing! I highly recommend this hotel to any traveler, business or pleasure. It's especially perfect for baseball fans (I had a great view of Petco from my eighth floor window!) Thanks to everyone at the Indigo for the warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “An overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: AtypicalGirl14
Reviews.Content: Great value, service and location. We could see Petco Park from our hotel room and so many of the places are walkable from this location. I had a great time staying at Hotel Indigo and I look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Stay at the Hotel Indigo!!”
Reviews.Author: joy_gravitt
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Indigo blew me away. I don't even know where to start. On our arrival there, we were promptly greeted by the valet and shown to the front desk. This is where we met David Ornelas. He was absolutely key in making our stay here at the Hotel Indigo a wonderful one. We were able to get an upgrade on our room since we mentioned it was our first year anniversary and we had a wonderful surprise of a complimentary bottle of wine to celebrate upon our return to the room later that night! When first walking into our room, we were totally taken aback by the beauty of it. It was simultaneously modern and inviting. The hardwood floors were beautiful and the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've had the pleasure of sleeping in. The TV was HUGE, which was a big plus for my husband and I loved the oversized chair and ottoman in the corner. The bathroom was immaculate. We loved the shower and size and the large amount of counter space for all your stuff!! We checked in on Friday, but our anniversary was on Saturday. After a full day of shopping and checking out Balboa Park, we returned to the hotel to see what kind of restaurant recommendations the front desk could offer us. Fortunately, David was working again and him and another helpful person recommended many restaurants which catered our every need (seafood, on 5th, patio seating). We decided on Asti for a nice italian dinner and David was able to make us reservations for that night. The dinner was amazing and our server had a little tip off that it was our anniversary. After dinner, we headed up for a relaxing nightcap at the rooftop bar for wonderful views of the city and great conversation. We are thoroughly pleased with our stay at the Hotel Indigo. Thanks to the entire staff that made our stay so memorable, but a special thanks to David O. We can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect boutique hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jay_N_Thomas
Reviews.Content: Weekend of 2 April 2011. Indigo is an very upscale version of the funky South Beach hotels -- very bright colors and open environment, but much cleaner and more comfortable than South Beach. Room is good size, plenty of window, very comfortable bed, spotless bathroom. Hotel is quiet (or soundproof, either way works). Staff is pleasant, and efficient, if not too friendly. Downstairs/lobby bar/restaurant is adequate. Only had breakfast there Saturday morning. It was "okay". Bartender serving it was pleasant. Yes. Valet parking is expensive. But, this is San Diego, and this is downtown. Deal with it. Fast WiFi available throughout the hotel. Superb property location. 5th & 6th Avenues are the downtown hot spots and the hotel is 4 blocks away, bay is about 12 blocks as is Little Italy. Easy walk. Neighborhood has lots of homeless, but they are not obtrusive nor threatening. Do not be intimidated walking to or from the hotel at night. San Diego's urban development is moving east. The restaurants & bars & clubs are expanding past 6th to 7th. It will only get better for the Indigo as the area around is built up and redeveloped. PS-1: Choose a restaurant on 5th Avenue but be not put off by the mobs of people. There are plenty of restaurants to get seated at, even on Saturday night. PS-2: Pay attention the drink prices if you go into one of the clubs. I paid over $20 for 2 glasses of wine at one. That's more ridiculous than the lobby bar in the Marriotts. Not so great stuff about the Indigo (hence my 4 stars): 1. Be prepared to wait for your car if you valet park. Valet car recovery is very very slow. 2. INEXCUSABLE for this hotel. The wonderful bar on the 9th floor is a great spot to just sit or meet. Good view. It has a great happy hour. BUT, it serves you wine and drinks in cheap little half sized PLASTIC cups! It's like getting a beer at a beach bar! I thought at first there was some sort of municipal restriction on glass containers on rooftops in San Diego, but, the other hotels have rooftop bars and serve drinks in real glass! What an amateur thing for the Indigo to do. Imagine your delightful Pinot Griggio served in a plastic cup! Talk about popping a bubble. How romantic! Ah! Nothing like the taste of plastic on a warm San Diego evening! Glad I didn't order champagne. Those are small (but notable) gripes. The hotel, as a hotel -- place to stay and sleep -- is first class. Location is truly ideal. Hotel is very clean and neat. Value is in the eye of the beholder but it is typical expensive of downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “My First Pick for a Hotel in San Diego is the Hotel Indigo...”
Reviews.Author: BonNaPlus3
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a professional conference and I chose to stay at a smaller hotel than the larger chain hotels, (which cost more than the Hotel Indigo). I was greeted very warmly by the valet and was quickly asisted with my bags by both the valet and bell hop. The front desk people were professional. I asked for a quiet room and I was given an end room on the 8th floor. As soon as I walked in to my room, I was very pleased with the bright cleanliness of my room. At the end of one day, I had coacktails and dinner in their small, intimate dining resturant. Fish of the day was awesome. Jason, the new server was friendly, and was truly concerned about the quality of my meal. He makes hotel guests very comfortable, and offered excellent personalized food service to all in the resturant/bar. The personnel at Hotel Indigo were truly concerned about service and comfort of their guests. I highly recommend this hotel for all types of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: 1ColetteMarie
Reviews.Content: An absolutely amazing hotel. The rooms had completely updated furniture and the bathroom was very much up -to-date as well. The room felt cozy and the bed was the most comfortable bed we've ever had at a hotel!! We never had a problem with noise (other than fire trucks outside). The staff was pleasant when approached, but didn't go out of their way to greet us. We loved that we were able to walk to several restaurants downtown!! The restaurant at the hotel had great food. The free high-speed internet was awesome!! The only downfalls of this hotel were the high valet parking fees (whew!!) and we would have liked a fridge in the room. Overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeUser
Reviews.Content: In our March 2011 visit, we found the Indigo to be an excellent hotel in all respects -- comfortable and quiet rooms, helpful staff, a good breakfast and bar, free Internet, and excellent location if you want to be downtown. The price was substantially lower than most nearby hotels and the only (slight) disappointment was the cost to valet park, higher than we are used to even in a large city center.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: putterpug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic in every way. The location is incredible as it overlooks Petco Park and is within walking distance to most everything downtown. The staff is the best....they made my wife and myself feel very welcome every time that I we stepped into the lobby. The bar staff and valet staff was also very friendly and extremely helpful. Simply the best. There is a bar in the lobby area as well as one on the 9th floor that is outside and overlooks the stadium. The outside bar has a couple firepits which made the experience even better. Try the Karl Strauss Red Trolley Beer upstairs and the Karl Strauss WindAndSea downstairs. Incredible local brewery. The exercise room in the hotel is out of this world. A gym which is full of commercial grade LifeFitness products including weights, eliptical and two 95ti Treadmills which are in my opinion is the best in the business. BUT...when you are in San Diego, there is no reason to stay on a treadmill. There is no pool and whirlpool which did not effect me in the least but some families may need a pool etc. The rooms are very spacious and have free Internet access. The TV's were at least 42 inches and flat screens. The room had hardwood floors which I have never seen before but added a great modern feel. The linens and bed quality was top-notch and the room included Aveda products. Stay at this hotel and you will not be disappointed. This is the hidden gem that you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - modern design-out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: White_lady_11
Reviews.Content: Love the design and the service. The roms are modern and comfortable. Liked especially the bar out doors on the 9th floor with open fires and a beautiful view of the city. Friendly and helpful service... close to being home!!! Bartender William fixed a great White Lady and provided a great atmospher at the bar - we sure want to go back - any day! Lady from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous service, food and room quality! A+, comfort & price!”
Reviews.Author: miafletcher
Reviews.Content: Dieter was an absolute pleasure to work with! The bar, dinning and conference facilities were top notch! The new modern amenities were refreshing. Absolutely felt at home the moment I walked through the doors of my room. The decor and bedding made the room extremely comfortable. The bar served one of the best mojitos I've ever had! The roof top bar also offered a fabulous view of the city both day and evening. The breakfast each morning was absolutely delicious! When the staff served us lunch in the conference room they were more than generous with our requests. I cannot say enough about the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff! The shower in the room and the comfort of the bedding were magnificent! Every time we needed anything, Dieter was amazing! A+++

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. Staff was really nice. Hotel was really nice, room was very large and was very clean. Valet is pretty pricey but there are lots local and there is also street parking. Would recommend that if possible, that's what I did.

Reviews.Title: “Pet stays for free!”
Reviews.Author: d9row
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego and decided to do a short staycation on a whim. My husband decided to book a hotel last minute through hotwire and we got lucky with Hotel Indigo for about $130 for a Saturday night. We didn't have any intentions to take our 4 1/2 year old puggle with us, but once we saw that she could stay for FREE (NO additional pet fee like most other hotels) she convinced us that she should come along for her first hotel stay. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the staff, especially SERGIO, was very friendly and made Gigi's first hotel stay so much fun. As far as the room, you can't beat the size for being in downtown. RATINGS: Cleanliness was 4 only because of a bit of dust. We informed the front desk, but decided it didn't bother us to the point that it needed to be taken care of. Sleep Quality got a 4 only because a loud car drove by late at night that could be heard even on 11th floor, beds were extremely comfortable so that made up for it. FLOOR: Laminate wood with an area rug. BED: Very comfortable, inbetween firm and soft. Pillows are very soft and fluffy. Gigi liked to hide under the bed so make sure you check under the beds for lost items. BATHROOM: Spacious with a Large shower (no tub). 1 sink with plenty of counter space. Aveda bath products are provided. VIEW: Floor to ceiling windows to admire the city view. ETC: Nice LG tv, but no mini fridge. iHome dock in room too. SUPER pet friendly! Gigi was able to go to the 9th floor and see the bar/lounge, grass patch, eat breakfast with us in their restaurant, and she got to run through the hallway. Petco Park's Park at the Park is only a 3 minute walk from the hotel which was open for her to take care of business and socialize with other dogs too. This hotel has APPLE products in the lobby :) REGRETS: Didn't get to try any happy hour specials...maybe next time! Starbucks, Basic (for pizza and they deliver to the hotel too), 7-11, Quizno's are all on the same block as the hotel. Lotus Thai, Tavern & Bowl (drink and bowl), The Corner (burgers) all "just across the sreet" from the hotel. 5 minute walk will get you to Heavenly cupcakes (but the run late at night, so go early) where you can get cupcakes for yourself and your dog.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: bballwey
Reviews.Content: I decided last minute to treat my husband to a night in San Diego's Gaslamp. Found a deal at Hotel Indigo and was skeptical about a place I hadn't stayed before. Well, it was not only one of the best places I have stayed (location, room decor, amenities) but the staff was amazing. Melissa at the front desk asked about our dinner plans and REALLY wanted us to have fun. We took one of her suggestions, which by the way she made the reservations for, and it was exactly what we wanted to do. Not only will we go back, but having corp. seats to Petco, we will have guests stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stat at a new, hip hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bruxie
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this dog-friendly hotel. The staff were very nice and the room and common areas were very clean. There is a restaurant/bar on the first floor. My steak was so-so, but the rest of the meal was great. If you don't mind walking four blocks, you can get to the San Diego strip (5th Ave.). I wish there were a microwave and fridge in my room, but the nice amenities made up for it. One request: please make over-the-counter meds (aspirin, benedryl, etc.) available at the front desk. I was told I could walk 3 blocks to CVS for meds, but that's not acceptable when you are sick. This hotel is a great value and I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, pet friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingEurope2007
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The decor was nice. Rooms were clean. Beds were comfortable. We stayed on the 11th floor. It was quiet and the view was breathtaking. Skyline, PETCO park, and harbor were visible. The 9th floor has a nice bar with fire pits and a water feature. Very beautiful at night. Walking distance to the Gaslamp. One block from ball park. My favorite thing about the hotel is that it is pet friendly. No extra charge for pets. No size limit or limit on number of pets. 9th floor has a grassy area for dogs and PETCO park is one block away. Would definitely stay at Hotel Indigo again. Valet parking is a bit expensive, but there is some public parking a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Portland-Witch
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel 4 blocks from scores of restaurants in San Diego's gaslamp district. Great rooms, great staff, from checkin to checkout a great experience overall. I look forward to my next trip to the Hotel Indigo. Only drawback is the $35 per day mandatory valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, it's very nice!”
Reviews.Author: mrdpbd
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Indigo for two nights. I will always stay there. It is small with personal service, clean, good service, free computer use, dog friendly, bright and colorful large rooms, good price, near many restaurants on 5th Ave., very close to Petco Park, within walking to the bay area where the Midway is, or an $8 cab ride, and a safe area. I have no negative remarks to say.

Reviews.Title: “=]”
Reviews.Author: mgarcia1265
Reviews.Content: stayed overnight during Mardi Gras, had a fantastic time. The hotel is great, the staff was friendly. The location is amazing!! Down the street from restaurants and nightlife. Our room was great, nice and big, colors are bright, very San Diego..... LOVED the shower Definetaley would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT all around pace to stay, super firendl;y and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: twig1027
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the GAs Lamp district and minutes to restaurants and the ball park. The hotel staff were over accomidating and met my/our everfy needs always there to assist you. Very enjoyable stay. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janameme
Reviews.Content: I travel for work. Out of all the hotels that I have to stay in, this is by far my favorite. The rooms are clean. The views of the city & Petco park-amazing. Its perfectly located. It's close enough to the Gaslamp Quarters to walk. Wonderful place to stay if your in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “A very unique botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve702
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The beautifully decorated rooms are large and very clean The hotel is a trendy and a unique place to stay. The lobby bar has a incredible open air feeling and like the rest of the hotel is very Dog friendly. We would have a drink at night in the lobby bar several guest as well as locals would be there with their dogs. The service we received from the Bar tenders ,especialy "William", was geniune and made you feel as if you were good friends. He would always ask you your were going and made suggestions if you were not sure. William even made a couple of phone calls to set up a special night out for us. The 9th floor has a balcony bar with fire pits and water features, and the view is a must see. This hotel is easy walking distance to 5th st were all the restaurants and night clubs are. The overall hotel staff was attentive helpful and awesome. We are already making plans to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Visitor friendly”
Reviews.Author: doctlow
Reviews.Content: It was a cold and rainy night ( hard to believe) and the room thermostat was locked and could NOT raise the room temperature above 62 degrees. Hotel employee came to our room and raised temperature slightly, still had thermostat restriction in place, still a cold night. Also received the check in run around - arrived early, advised to return in 3 hours, room ready by 3pm. At 3 pm a different front desk clerk repeated the room not ready speech and wanted to send us off again - we persisted and were given a room at that time. Not a hospitality friendly atmosphere, will not return. There are a lot of great places to stay in Gas Lamp area, this just is not one of them. Not willing to pay $250 + a night for average hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “I COULD HAVE LIVED THERE, I DIDN'T WANT TO GO HOME”
Reviews.Author: lisamarshall1224
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Perfect location! Great service. Everyone was so nice. The restaurant was great, The employees are great, the rooms are great ,and the beds were amazing! I slept better than i do at home!

Reviews.Title: “Best of San Diego, absolutely delightful”
Reviews.Author: wredheffer
Reviews.Content: Warm friendly employees, customer service extraordinary. At the front desk Peyton was very helpful answering questions and suggesting places to see and the best mode of transportation. We started our day with breakfast at the hotel and Tiago, our server had a warm good morning for us everyday, food was delicious and the service was friendly and efficient. At the end of our day, William the bartender always welcomed us with a smile, used our names and remembered our preferences. My husband has a wheat allergy and needed gluten free food as well as Redbridge beer, which was no problem. The staff was well aware of my husbands needs and went out of their way to ensure his food was properly prepared and there was plenty of cold gluten free beer on hand. (We couldn't find any other place in town with gluten free beer) When you visit, check out the roof top bar with the fire pits, absolutely delightful

Reviews.Title: “5-star service without the 5-star expense”
Reviews.Author: BlkOps
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything anyone could look for in a hotel, without having to sacrifice expenses. The location is excellent; the hotel is new and everything was clean; and the staff, from Front Office management to housekeeping, are the epitome of customer service and hospitality. I coordinated an event in San Diego, with attendees arriving from all over the country. From the day we arrived, the staff showed nothing but excellent service. Here are some employees that absolutely stand out in my mind as having gone above and beyond for me and my colleagues: - David (the shorter one), at the front desk, did an excellent job of taking care of all the attendees during check-in. He ensured that they were all checked-in in a timely manner and provided them information that was pertinent to our event. - Adriana (Bar Manager) ensured that her staff was well aware of our group's reception/ice-breaker and always checked in with me to make sure everything was going well. Michelle was the bartender that took great care of us on the 9th Floor Lounge; and William was the primary bartender in the afternoons, at the main bar downstairs, who took care of group orders for those who chose to partake in a beverage after our meetings. These two were not only great employees but had a great personalities. Remember the names of members of my group was a true sign of how much they enjoy their work and the guests. - Derick (Director of Food and Beverage) worked with me in arranging a procedure where the transition between meeting to lunch was seamless, by taking advanced orders and ensuring that the wait for food orders was minimized. - Michael did an excellent job in attending members that ordered their breakfast from the restaurant and also did an excellent job in assisting Derick in getting lunch out in a timely manner. - Adrian, from Banquets, made contact with me on the first day we were going to use the meeting rooms and was very attentive in our needs for our AM and PM service and AV needs. Matt assisted him in getting the room set up and ensured everything was always stocked. - And last but not least, there is Kelsey, Sales Manager. Kelsey worked with me for over 2 months in ensuring our meeting was a great success. Not only did she endure several emails and phone calls from me, but was also asked to work with my California reps in coordinating the reception/ice-breaker. Kelsey was the key figure in the hotel. Not only did she ensure that all of the employees I mentioned, were made aware of our group, but also other employees within the hotel. Throughout the time we were there, my group members were coming up to me to tell me of their positive experience with all members of the hotel staff, and how throughout the stay everyone in the group felt like they were treated as VIPs. Due to my job, I've stayed in hotels ranging from no-star to 5-star and without a doubt, this hotel made me feel more of a valued guests than any other. The attentiveness, personalities and care felt genuine and sincere. Whereas other hotels felt more like it was just "part of the job" to be nice. This is the epitome of what the hospitality industry should be. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning on visiting San Diego, and I know that I will be staying here again in the future, regardless of whether it's for business or pleasure. THANKS, Hotel Indigo - San Diego!! Hope to see you all again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a young stylish environment”
Reviews.Author: quebec123go
Reviews.Content: We found everything that we usually expect from a great hotel (good service, clean rooms, quietness, etc) at Indigo. But in addition, we were pleasantly surprised by the young, stylish, cool atmosphere. It is a nice environment friendly hotel. Also if you are a pet owner/lover you will just feel at home. Parking is rather expensive, however there is meter parking available on the streets around the hotel, but be cautious of the signs (days/times not to park). Everyone was very nice, just to name a few, Joseph at the reception and Ish at the restaurant were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “ABOVE AND BEYOND/BEST OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: PatKuykendall33
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Indigo, San Diego is awesome! In town for leadership training and this hotel "raised the bar" among the other ones in San Diego. Starting with Kelsey the Sales Manager/Derick the Director of Food and Beverage these are professionals who know the hospitality business. The attitude and friendliness of these two leaders was outstanding. Andrian and Matt took awesome pride during our banquets (always a smile and can do attitude), Michael was our breakfast host and was always one step ahead of our requests (great attitude and service) and our adult beverage servers Adrianna, William and David were always funny, friendly, helpful and very very professional. The hotel Indigo is years ahead of the other hotels in the area. The housekeeping staff were professional and very helpful. Also the valet and bell service was fast, courteous and like everyone else in this hotel "FRIENDLY AND PROFESSIONAL".

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: lindsayamber
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel and the staff was wonderful. William (he works in the restaurant) was a great host/waiter and very knowlegeable about the area and gave us great ideas of places to go. I would suggest this place to anyone. Also, I loved the pillows!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo was very trendy, chic, and new feeling! Plus, the location was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: wildcats06
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in the Gaslamp Quarter, this is the perfect pick. You can easily walk to any restaurant or shopping you need near the Convention Center and in the Gaslamp Quarter. The hotel is very clean and fresh feeling. The staff is always available to help with travel questions or assist in room questions. We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to others traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, jazzy lobby, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: FlytheTail
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at this great hotel. It's LEED certified, modern, and comfortable. Upon entering my large room, saw two bottles of water and a box of jelly beans with a nice hand written card, thanking me for my business and platinum status. Free wifi, great tv, very comfortable bed, large walk-in show, Aveda products, etc. made for a very enjoyable stay. This was my first Hotel Indigo stay and it certainly won't be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Clean and cool. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jamesah108
Reviews.Content: This is a cool hotel. The rooms are comfy and have great decor. It's only a few short blocks from the main Gaslamp spots. It's an easy walk...5 minutes tops. The staff was helpful, although not entirely knowledgeable. There are iMac's in the lobby as well as free wifi in the rooms. The views are great and there's a rooftop terrace with fire pits (only open until about 10pm). I would stay here again. This hotel is good for young or old. Parking at the hotel is way too expensive so plan on parking around the corner at a lot or at the parking meters on the street (free from 6pm-8am). There is a restaurant and bar on site but I didn't use either so I have no opinion on them. I was happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a place you would want to return to!”
Reviews.Author: Deewolfemassage
Reviews.Content: From the Valet service when we first arrived and than David was so accommedating at the front desk. The service that was over the top, was by William in the floor leval bar. His ability to acess the FUN meter and make it happen! He was very knowledgeable about the area and the hotel. Adriana was just as awesome on the Roof.....Roof top lounge was an awesome place to have a beverage and take in the beauty. BTW - Rooms were spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but some careless service...”
Reviews.Author: cats77
Reviews.Content: i would so love to give this hotel 5 stars, but i simply cannot. first off - the positives: friendly people, great location, relatively clean premises. we stayed in the terrace suite which was nice and spacious and the only room with a balcony and wonderful view of petco park. this balcony, i thought, was only for our use, but perhaps it was different during the day since we saw some people out there as we were leaving for the day. not much of a big deal since we were about to leave, but still a bit annoying. also... we ordered room service twice... only two sliders per order, bummer. and everything was luke warm. when we came back from the first day we opened the suite to a pretty heavy smell of lemon. however, we both noticed that there was a bit of a smoky smell in the bathroom. perhaps the cleaning folks smoked in the bathroom and then tried to offset it with some lemon scented air freshner. the second day we came back, no smells, but a half full cleaning bottle was left out on the bed, the trash was not emptied, we did not receive a box of tissues when we blatantly were nearing the end, nor did we recieve another shampoo. if you're paying X amount of dollars for accomodation, you hope that service is impeccable. it wasn't here. i could be petty about it, but all those little things added up lead me to say that the service is lacking here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find!!!”
Reviews.Author: tnlake
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a work conference with my husband for 3 nights. The hotel is only 2 blocks from the popular Gaslamp which has tons of great restaurants and shopping. The hotel is very modern and trendy looking. Arrived a few hours early and was not able to check early since our room wasn't ready. This was a problem for me since I am nursing a baby and needed to pump since the baby did not come on the trip with us. The front desk was extremelly helpfully and escorted me to a private restroom upstairs where I could pump in peace. Once we checked in, we found our room to very clean and extremelly comfortable. Flat screen TV with cable, spa like shower, and plenty of plush soft pillows for relaxing. The bar/restaurant in the lobby was a great spot to relax and hang out in as well. Reasonably priced food and cocktails(the french toast and bloddy mary's were my fav). There are even 2 ipads in the lobby that they let you tinker around with(FOR FREE) if you wanna check your email or facebook. We would bring ours over to the bar area while waiting for our food, very fun to play with. I would definitely stay at this hotel again next time we are in town!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, service & location”
Reviews.Author: ajtcvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Valentine's day weekend....The room was breathtaking and the views were unreal!! Ambiance is relaxing and upbeat. Staff was accomodating and super responsive to our needs. We were within walking distance to many of our favorite hot spots... Parking is so easy with valet. Could have stayed there all week. The best hotel in Downtown San Diego! Best part is when you return to the hotel the night is not over, There is a swanky bar downstairs with street/corner view and one on the 9th floor with a city view, music and heatlamps...perfect way to end the evening. Oh, and the Aveda products in the room are a breath of fresh air from many other hotel brands....Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: gailndan
Reviews.Content: From valet to houskeeping and everywhere in between, entir staff is dedicated to your comfort. Beatiful facility, super location.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Hombresg33
Reviews.Content: The Indigo in San Diego was absolutely amazing. We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. The room is very modern, with hardwood floors, great art on the walls, large high def tv, very comfortable bed. The bathroom is great, love the stool in the shower. The Aveda products are great. The 9th floor deck is amazing, a great place to have a drink and enjoy the views. Overall one of the best hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The most fantastic Room with a view thanks to a wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: NickelsanddimesLA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Platinum members of the Priority Club for hotel chain, and luckily, this has it's perks. Before our arrival at the hotel, Darren, one of the managers, called my husband to tell him that because of our membership status and because we were newlyweds and the hotel wanted to make sure our stay was extra special, they were giving us a complimentary upgrade to their Presidential Suite! Now that is customer service! We were warmly greeted at the reception desk by Dietre and Peyton, who throughout our stay were both very knowledgeable about the area and helpful in recommendations about where to go and what to do.They really made the trip feel extra special and made us feel very welcome, and at home. The room itself was wonderful. We had our own private balcony that looked out over the city, a living room area, bathroom with a luxurious tub and seperate shower, and a bedroom that just made you never want to leave! Everything about our stay was absolutely perfect. We are absolutely smitten with this hotel and cannot wait to go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Dieter Schmitz and mellissa at front desk were the best. I travel alot and this has to be one of best stays ever. Went to celebr”
Reviews.Author: Fito38
Reviews.Content: Dieter Schultz and mellissa at the front desk were the best. They will go out of there way to help you and make your stay enjoyable. Ask for them when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous botique hotel w/ impecable service and cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: mikedpoway
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous view of petco park and easy walk to gaslamp district. Extremely dog friendly. Rooms are always impeccably clean and staff is most inviting. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying downtown. Showers are large and great water pressure. Beds are out of this world comfortable and nice, big flatscreen. Menu is simply amazing in restaurant and room service equally as enticing. Have stayed at least a dozen times and always been satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, great service but...”
Reviews.Author: sdgurlvent
Reviews.Content: First off Peyton checked us in and was very friendly and helpful. I was born and raised in SD and thought it would be fun to try a different hotel close to all of the downtown bars. We were not disappointed. Hotel Indigo is right in the heart of Gaslamp with a fantastic bar overlooking Petco Park. The rooms were very modern and clean. Service was excellent! The negatives about this hotel are as follows: 1) The red wine served at the bar tasted like vinegar. We were with a party of 10 and we all said the same thing. They need more of a wine selection! 2) In some areas of the hotel it smelled like a sewage pipe broke. 3) I love that they are pet friendly- but would not recommend having guests bring their pets to the restaurant. We were eating breakfast and noticed other guests walking their dogs right through! 4) The elevator system! We had so many problems getting our room cards to activiate the floor buttons. Frustrating. If not for the items listed above, I would score them 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Make this the ONLY Hotel to stay in while in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: katie_ruskin
Reviews.Content: The very best staff that you could ever want to find in any hotel. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are amazing. The hotel diner has really reasonable prices with great food. The wait staff deserves HUGE rewards: To William and Tai and the rest of the crew: I wish I could have taken every single one of them home with me!

Reviews.Title: “One Night in Gaslamp, was excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: gilkesjm
Reviews.Content: Hotel provided excellent location to easily relax and enjoy the gaslamp district within a block. Loved the overall modern feel of hotel. 9th Floor Terrace bar is an exceptional space. The room was a bit dusty, but overall excellent visit. Pillow top bed, spa style bathroom - couldn't have been more plush!

Reviews.Title: “No room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: beckylarsson
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo far exceeded our expectations. It was one of the best hotels i've ever stayed at - and my partner and i have done plenty of travelling. After ariving in on a long flight from Australia, we couldn't have been greeted with a more comforting welcome from the staff at Indigo - the friendly Scott Darren gave us some great local tips and we were even lucky enough to meet Dieter from Laguna Beach reality show who welcomed us at the front desk! Our room had plenty of natural light, was spacious, spotlessly clean and had two HD televisions! The supersized bed was more comfortable than my bed at home and my partner couldn't get over the fact that we had views right into the Petco Stadium-home of the San Diego Padres. Be sure to check out the outside bar on level 9 which has fire pits and serves great cocktails-ask for an espresso martini. The sliders are also good for a pre dinner snack. Inigo is located in the Gaslight district which is ultra cool and in walking distance to all the major bars and restaurants. We went to one great Mexican Teqilla Bar called El Vitral which has over 200 types of Teqila! We had a great stay at Indigo and would definitely return. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: doraCanada
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Pet friendly. Was able to change rooms when barking dog disturbed us. Walking distance to a million great eateries and tourist activities. Not great views but did not stay in the room except to sleep. Really comfy beds and pillows. Staff very pleasant. Free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Antigony
Reviews.Content: I am a little behind with my revivew but I wanted to review this fantastic hotel in downtown San Diego! It's only a few minutes from all the bars and restaurants, up the street from Petco Park (I could see right into the stadium from my room). It's a new, modern hotel, with huge rooms, comfortable bedding, large bath room. Very impressive furniture. The service is excellent, the bar is gorgeous with the huge window fronts that open. Valet parking is available, and the rate was very acceptable for the location! I will definitely recommend the hotel and come back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful in every respect”
Reviews.Author: tabetha81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a convention. The hotel was perfectly located to walk to the convention center, and everywhere else for that matter. The atmosphere had an upscale feel, but in an absolutely relaxed, laid back kind of way. Everyone was more than helpful during my stay. I thoroughly enjoyed everything, and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “May be the nicest smelling hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: mcrouch77
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel very much. My first night I was awakened at 4am by the noise of my neighbors having a screaming match with each other. Then their dog joined in. One courteous trip to the front desk and I was moved to a different room immediately. The rest of my stay 4 night stay was great! The hotel is very clean. It was remarkable how good the lobby, elevator, hallway, room smelled at all times. The bed is very comfortable and the shower is great too. The hotel is a little bit removed from the Gaslamp district but still within walking distance. There are quite a few luxury condos nearby so the neighborhood felt pretty safe overall. A good hotel choice for laid back San Diego vibe downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing room and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: JosieDean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days on our honeymoon and on arrival were upgraded to a room that overlooked petco park. It was amazing and 5 minutes after checking in they brought us champagne to our room with a note from the staff very lovely touch. The room was really clean and I recommend eating lunch on the 9th floor terrace as it has great view looking at the baseball stadium. The BBQ wrap is amazing with coleslaw, avocado, cheese and sweet potatoe fries lush. Great location and brilliant facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved at first sight...left to never return”
Reviews.Author: Chjen144
Reviews.Content: I did love this hotel. However, when we got to our room and it stunk. I expected an upgrade or some type of credit to my bill but received nothing. When I complained to the manager his response was "well sometimes things happen" The manager was a short, skinny, blond haired, white guy (if upper management is wondering). I loved the faux wood floors until 2am when the girl staying abovet me returned to her room and walked her heals back and forth for what seemed like hours. I admire that they are pet friendly. The rooftop bar overlooking the city had wonderful night time views. Over all a great place, I truly wish I could return but I cannot accept an attitude from a manager.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at the periphery of Gaslamp Quarter, mediocre service levels”
Reviews.Author: reviewguy
Reviews.Content: The good: spacious rooms, well appointed, free wireless internet within 3 blocks of the gaslamp district. Free use of iMacs in the lobby. Sergio the bellman was wonderful. The not so good: understaffed front desk with little or no warmth in welcoming guests (yes we know its a business for you - but you are in the hospitality business and it was my annual vacation - a little smile cannot hurt!). Single restaurant with limited offerings (but genuinely friendly bar staff.) High valet parking cost (plenty of street options including paid 24 hour lots in the vicinity that are far cheaper). No minibar, no safe in room. Lots of dining options within walking distance, also a Starbucks around the corner, a 7-11, an Albertsons for groceries if you so desired, within 5 minutes walking distance. Hotel was a hit and miss. We were happy with the slightly large rooms but not with the lack of amenities that we expected of such a highly ranked 4* hotel.
