I'd go back, but not before thoroughly reviewing other options in the heart of the Gaslamp district (Hilton and Omni seemed to have the best locations.)

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel with warm, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: suziewaubeeka
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up curbside, we were warmly welcomed. Our checkin was warm and efficient. The lobby was great. In moments we were on our way up to the room in a taking elevator. My first impression of the room was WOW. I took pictures right away. Lots of great pillows on the bed and a lovely tray with glasses was on the attractive spread. The bathroom had a spa like feeling. Teak bench in the shower. Even the blow dryer was great. The room was so attractive that I put my suitcase in the closet so as not to ruin the look. I loved relaxing in the lobby with the Ipads that were free to use there. There is a great bar on the ninth floor with outdoor seating with firepits heatlamp and flat screen TV,s on the glass enclosed patio. The hotel is also pet friendly. Thank you to Melissa and Darren at the front desk, Abraham at curbside and all the other staff who made my visit so pleasant! Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...horrible services”
Reviews.Author: Hank_H20
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the holidays at the Hotel Indigo with our extended family and were very disapointed with the level of service that we were given. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are spacious and well decorated. Unfortunately, we repeatedly had to call just to receive the bare essentials in maid service to all 6 of the rooms that we had booked. We were never given towels, the beds were not made, and the trash was not taken out. These are minimal cleanliness standards that one would receive at even a Super8 motel and we did not receive them at Hotel Indigo in all 8 days that we stayed at the hotel. It would be easy to excuse a lack of staff or some other issue with a simple explaination or apology from the staff but we were not given one. I am left to assume that this is the way that the Hotel Indigo runs their hotel. Unfortunately, this made for a very disapointing stay at this hotel and we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent excellent excellent”
Reviews.Author: likestoeat53
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying here very much! Lovely room and spacious. Location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: mikneliz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with a few other couples to attend a party nearby. The whole experience from start to finish was top notch. The staff at check in were extremely friendly and gave us a room on the top floor. The rooms are big and very clean and beautiful....great shower! We ended our night at the bar on the 9th floor and the atmosphere was very cool. The bartender totally took care of us! The breakfast the next day was delicious and again the staff was great. I would highly recommend staying here and hope to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: jess140710
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for one night in December. We LOVED it! We got it on Priceline for 99 bucks a night. It was worth every penny. Such a beautiful hotel. The rooms were clean and gorgeously appointed. I have never seen a hotel room with hardwood floors. Would recommend it to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDRivergirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a night to just get away. I am from San Diego and was looking for a hotel in the Gaslamp that I could retreat to after a night out. I didn't want to leave the hotel! I loved it! The room size was perfect. The bed was comfortable. And, I LOVED the bathroom and the shower. I felt very comfortable here and will definitely keep it in mind when I am looking to stay downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Roof Top Bar”
Reviews.Author: roxyandrews
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Indigo while I was visiting a friend in San Diego. This hotel is a cool boutique hotel, clean ans nice with a little spunk. Great rooms, comfy beds and I loved the roof top bar with the fire pits. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggie10lou
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in October but reviews would not let me put that in. An absolutely beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. Would never stay anywhere else in San Diego. Just LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “It's the people who make the stay”
Reviews.Author: rosedico
Reviews.Content: I particularly want to acknowledge the staff at Hotel Indigo. Everyone was so pleasant and professional. I ate in Table 509 several times. My first stop was upon my arrival. I was STARVING. Michael and Tai in the restaurant/bar brought me a snack while I awaited my lunch. They both took genuine care and interest; more importantly they truly seemed to enjoy their work. Do you know what a pleasant treat that is?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views, Great Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: maris178
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in the Gaslamp in San Diego. The Hotel Indigo is Top 2 for me! The views from our room were UNBELIEVABLE! We actually slept at the opposite end of the bed just so that we could admire them! The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. I especially liked Steve at the Valet desk who made sure he was pronouncing my name correctly (as most people don't). He was exceptional and greeted us every time we came in and left the hotel. The location is great, although a little bit of a walk to area bars/restaurants. But, definitely not far from anything by any means. The hotel is new and the decor is beautiful. I absolutely loved our rooms and the bathroom is fantastic! Great shower! I was extremely impressed. I would absolutely stay here again and definitely recommend it to others!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sergio & his soccer buds”
Reviews.Author: Gamedish
Reviews.Content: Brand new & great looking hotel. Staff are friendly ESP. Sergio & the soccer team :). My son, his dad & I appreciate that they made us feel at home. Not to mention the awesome view of petco park, so close to everything downtown sd has to offer, great room and no carpets here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelHaik
Reviews.Content: Thanks to tripadvisor, this was a great find to ring in the New Year! Special thanks to Dieter for excellent service and allowing a late checkout. Upgraded to a nice corner room on the 7th floor. The Gaslamp Quarter was an outstanding place including dinner at one of the best restaurants I have ever been to - Georges on 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel without the chain hotel feel to it”
Reviews.Author: jeffofescondido
Reviews.Content: We found a discounted rate at this top end property. From the moment we pulled up to the time of our departure we were treated like long time valued guests. Well trained staff in all areas of customer service, very stylish,neuvo, Mac friendly environment. If you are staying overnight on a Saturday, use street parking after 4pm use your quarters to get two hours of time. After 6pm and all day Sunday street parking is free. I was a little concerned about my BMW on the street, as it all worked out, I had a view of my car from my room. This area is well lit, quiet and safe. It also is in walking distance of the Gas Lamp district. We ate at Oceanaire, the best seafood spot in the area. Order the crab-cakes they are the best. The room is comfortable, not overly spacious. Certainly met the needs of the two of us. Nice size bathroom, plenty of storage space. I also like the fact you need a key to get to your floor. Adds to the feeling of security. We enjoyed the 9th floor outdoors bar with fire pits and plenty of seating, some TV's for viewing if sporting events. The bartender was friendly and professional. Great views of Petco Park :Home of the Padres". Free Wi-FI and large lobby for lounging. Will stay here again as it was very warm and reasonably priced. I also noticed that the Hawaiian Airlines crew in the lobby in the morning, which also tells me that they must have high enough standards to host airline crew.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hellohowareyou
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel located conveniently in the Gas Lamp Quarter. The rooms were well appointed and the staff was very friendly. I wish the restaurant had better options, though. I found it limited. Also, instead of valet parking, I would recommend using the lots nearby if you cannot get a metered street spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: avalonislandgirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I did a little weekend getaway to San Diego. This hotel was in a great location, clean, with nice amenities. Vinney (Vincent), the concierge, was awesome. He was very patient with us and gave us directions many times throughout our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are heading to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation”
Reviews.Author: AndDeb
Reviews.Content: This is a great contemporary, warm property about 2 blocks from the Petco Park (our room had a view, hardwood floors and looked right at the field). It was really clean and nice, pet friendly (the entrance has a doggie dish, as does the bar on the 9th floor which is out-doors (has fire pits, chairs views of the city toward the ballpark, etc) and has grassy area around the corner for the dogs. I must mention Tai - he was friendly and made numerous great restaurant recommendations, and was the icing on the cake of our anniversary celebration. Since this property is located on 9th Avenue - it is near the ballpark and the residential East Village district. You are in the city so there is some noise. This is great for locals who want a "staycation" or people who know the city and want a different view and experience in our city. We were within walking distance of numerous fun things, and it totally felt like we'd gone "out of town," but were 15 minutes from where we live. We didn't do any of the things we normally would - tried new restaurants, walked to different areas...I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: westcoastgirrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Indigo for 2 nights at the beginning of November prior to a cruise. Check in was a breeze: no line, everything was ready for us. I booked ahead of time and got a great price for a location within walking distance to the Gaslamp. We had ALOT of luggage and the bellman helped us to our room quickly and answered any questions we had. I used the free wireless wifi on my iPhone with no troubles. And I really enjoyed the clock radio with iPhone dock to charge it up. The room was very clean and decor was nice. The huge shower was awesome. I liked the Aveda products provided. I had no trouble with customer service at the front desk. I asked for a nice restaurant for breakfast and they directed us to a place called The Mission (which is sooo fabulous btw). We didn't go to the lounges or eat at the hotel as we had small kids with us. We did walk to the Gaslamp and felt completely safe. A CVS was nearby too which was convenient to pick up some things for our cruise. Check out was equally quick. The valet's were very helpful in getting us transportation to the cruise port (we needed a van to fit our luggage). I really enjoyed this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to return to it if I wanted to be close to the Gaslamp area again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: strickland6789
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel. The customer service was exceptional, the food was incredible, and I was upgraded to a room with a view of Petco Stadium. The hotel is dog friendly and the staff had adopted a dog from a local shelter while I was there. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, accomodations and service”
Reviews.Author: mallorygom
Reviews.Content: I typically don't write hotel reviews, but I had such a positive experience with this hotel that I felt the need to do so. Upon arriving, the hotel checked in our large group with a friendly disposition and expedience. The rooms were beautiful and we had access to great restaurants and nightlife. I was particuarly impressed by one employee by the name of Tai who went out of his way to take care of our group and make our experience great. It's an overall great value and I would highly recommend the hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonCruiser
Reviews.Content: If I were to tell you that the Hotel Indigo was one of the most hip, chic, swanky and dog-firendly hotels I have ever had the pleasure to stay in, it would be an understatement. From the airy and roomy lobby with the Phi bar, to the beautifully adorned rooms, it has it all. When we checked in, we were greeted by very warm, friendly and knowledgable staff who were happy to assist us. The rooms are amazing! Hardwood floors (I mean have you ever heard of such a thing?), huge beds with luxurious bedding, spa-like shower, and a mini-Keurig coffee maker in the room (if you own a Keurig, you know why I was happy)! Bottom line, a great place to stay and convenient to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Luxo prices for less-than-luxo accommodations”
Reviews.Author: CaTraveler7777
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a sort of dodgy area; the place next door is a flophouse that has a sign up front warning potential clients that "alcohol and weapons will not be tolerated". The Indigo is not a flophouse, as it is clean, has an ultra-modern decor, and has a decent restaurant and a bar upstairs. The rooms are spare, with no carpeting - a sort of wood-like floor instead. There is not enough room on the bathroom counter for a toiletries kit. The room has an old-style air conditioning unit that clunks on and off. The cost of parking your car is high for SD; something north of $35 with tax and tip - there is no self park at the hotel. The cost of the room is also quite high; higher than the luxury hotels a few blocks away on the water. On the good side, the free wireless Internet is much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk terrible, clean and good location - deserves its official 3.5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: image1
Reviews.Content: First of all, this review is mostly about the service... the hotel is immaculate and modern, as everyone says, and the location is convenient. I stayed at the Hotel Indigo in the Gaslamp Quarter at the beginning of November 2010 for 6 nights. My wife was at a conference at the Convention Center and I decided to work out of the hotel room. I had read reviews on TripAdvisor that mentioned others being able to check in earlier than the 3 pm check-in time and thought I'd ask beforehand. I called the night before and was told that not all rooms were booked and might be able to check in early the next morning since my wife's conference started at 9 am. After I dropped off my wife and gave the hotel a call. Kimberly told me that they were all booked and to call back at noon to see if any rooms were available then. I called back at 12:30 pm and Kimberly told me that they were still all booked and the room I had requested was still occupied and the person had requested a late check out. I found it hard to believe that no other rooms were available, but I thought "sure, I get it, technically the check-in time is 3 pm and hopefully they will extend the same courtesy to me when I request a late check out on our last day." When I finally was able to check in at 4 pm, I was told by the valet guy that the bell hop was not available and I could wait, but I decided to check in regardless because I had such a long day already. Carrying more bags and equipment than I could handle, no one at the front desk even offered to help me after handing me the keys to the room. The next day, I realized that I needed to vacate the room for a couple of hours so that housekeeping could clean the room and decided on an extended lunch from 12-2 pm. When I came back, the room had still not been cleaned, but I needed to get work done, so I realized we just had to go without a clean room for a night. The next day, I left at 11 am and told the front desk of the situation and they said the room would be cleaned by the time I got back. At 3 pm, I went back to my room and the "cleaning service requested" sign was still on my door handle, I went to the front desk and complained about how it had been 4 hours and no one had cleaned the room. They apologized and said that I was next on the list, so I went to the lounge for about 30 minutes. When I returned, the room had finally been cleaned and I thought this would be over with. The next day, the same thing happened... over the course of our stay, our room had only been cleaned 3 times. The front desk didn't even communicate our request to the cleaning staff. Fast forward to the last day. I was told by Peyton at the front desk that 11 am was the check-out time, so I requested an extension given that one had been granted to whoever stayed in our room previously and that resulted in me checking in after 3 pm on the first day. Peyton said "maybe we can give you to 11:30 or noon at the latest because we are expecting a full house." Nice, I thought. Now, I'm a reasonable person, I realize there are official times for check-in and check-out - I get it. However, for there to be very little flex is ridiculous... if I can wait until 3 pm for check in, why can't someone else and why can't the front desk just go the extra mile and say: "Listen, we have a full house, but here's what I can do. I will give you until 1 or 2 pm... just make sure you let me know when you're going to check out so I can get the cleaning staff into the room as soon as possible. How does that sound?" Now, that would be service... unfortunately, you won't find that at the Hotel Indigo in San Diego. Regarding their room service: my wife ordered $40 worth of dinner (which she said was terrible quality, btw - I had read about this in previous reviews). She was astounded at the bad service she got. We didn't have any menus in our room, so she asked the room service people to give her some options, to which they responded "Um, it's really hard to tell you what we have if you don't have a menu." She thought, why is it my fault there's no menu in my room? And then when they finally arrived, they asked, "where do you want me to put this" and just dropped the tray on the bed. Nice. Finally, the Valet: after leaving the car in the garage for 3 days, I was surprised to find a distinct sewer smell in my car. The valet guys had told me that the hotel had been working on the smell, but even after a night of driving and airing out the car, the smell lingered. The same thing happened the next day and I finally realized that I should close the vents in the car, which helped. But after complaining to the Valet, they said they would let their manager know and that I should also speak to the front desk, who immediately blamed the Valet guys. Again, no help from the front desk. Anyway, one of the Valet guys told their manager and he spoke with the GM who eventually compensated all of my parking charges, which was a nice gesture. Another note, even though Valet parking is expensive at $32/day, I knew that going into the situation and I realized that it was worth it for the security and convenience. Plus, the Valet guys were very nice and I think they even felt bad about how much they were charging, so they were extra friendly. Anyway, I thought if the front desk was half as friendly and helpful as the Valet guys, I would have had a much more pleasant experience. Bottom line: The front desk (Kimberly and Peyton) were not very helpful... I got pat answers and nothing remotely resembling actual troubleshooting and service. Actually, there were 2 people that stood out from the rest: Bruce and Dieter... they actually were helpful and at least provided other alternatives for my needs. The Valet was expensive, but they know it and provide great service. I was disappointed because I had heard that the service was very friendly, but I didn't find that to be the case... at most times, it seemed unprofessional, run by young trainees, and not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms at this boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mailmanwill
Reviews.Content: Prompt check in and very friendly staff at the Indigo. Nice funky room and a lot bigger than I thought it would be for a boutique type hotel. Nice fitness room and decks on the 9th floor. Parking at $32.00 a night is a little steep so we took our rental back before staying at the hotel for two nights. Close to myriads of restaurants for every budget and we could have watched a baseball game at PETCO Park from the 9th floor last week if the Padres didn't fall short in the NL West. Maybe next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! If you are looking for good customer service this is not for you!!!”
Reviews.Author: bjack830
Reviews.Content: The worst customer service I've ever experienced. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary design, very comfortable and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterSantaFe
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Indigo. Bed was comfortable, room was clean with no weird smells. I appreciated the fact that the windows opened. A bit noisy outside, but it is just a few blocks from Petco Park.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location, cute dog...what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: christiem2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in the perfect location for having a break in San Diego. Friendly staff, who were helpful and knowledgeable about restaurant recommendations. Beautiful decor, nice big rooms, great shower. Only slight niggle was no rest room in the gym that I could see so had to trek down seven floors in the middle of a workout to use the facilities....answer to that of course being dont work out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel. Room 916 with the patio is just amazing..”
Reviews.Author: mikedpoway
Reviews.Content: Was our 2 year anniversary and everything was just outstanding. Had some champagne and cheese up in the room. Then enjoyed the firepits barside. Staff was super friendly and the views are great. Thanks again. Perfect stay and highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews - this place is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LittleBritOregon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this weekend for his birthday. It was a surprise, so I did a lot of research about areas and hotels, and finally settled on Hotel Indigo. It was absolutely fantastic, and I can't recommend it highly enough. We brought our dog with us, which I really hesitated over because although hotels may say that they are "dog-friendly", often they are just "dog-tolerant". There are usually all sorts of rules and regulations, and fees, and it's just a bit stressful. Hotel Indigo is really different - they genuinely welcome dogs. No fees, no restrictions, and they actually looked happy to see our dog at check in! There is a little park a block away right in front of Petco Park where dogs run off leash. Also, the hotel obviously goes to great pains to ensure that the hotel does not feel doggy - it is immaculate, and very stylish. For once, our dog actually enjoyed her weekend away too. The area is brilliant and the hotel could not be more convenient for the many bars and restaurants. Lastly, the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful -probably the best service we have had at a hotel for a while. I agonized about whether to spend the extra cash and stay at Hotel Solamar, but I'm glad we didn't, because I don't think we could have had a better experience than we had at Hotel Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TXTraveler079
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Inigo every weekend for a span of two months. The restaurant was good, the service was amazing and the rooms were very comfortable. My work required me to stay in and around the hotel for most of my visits so I spent lots of time in the hotel restaurant enjoying the food and chatting with the employees. The staff was always friendly and accommodating and even started to feel a bit like home after my frequent visits over the two months. Anytime I had a question about places I could enjoy outside of the hotel Claire and Dieter at the front desk were very quick to point me in the right direction. I had a lovely time at Hotel Indigo and would definitely stay there again for my next San Diego vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: nellyNix
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Indigo several times in the past year. The hotel is Pet friendly and super cute. The decor is tasteful, youthful and modern. My room always has amazing view overlooking Petco Park. Dieter from the front desk recommended Asti for dinner, which was a GREAT suggestion and even offered to put us on the list at various night clubs. My friends and I had a blast! I have recommended Hotel Indigo to many friends, co-works and family and they have all loved their stay as well!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: bigbob049
Reviews.Content: We held a very important meeting during a major convention in San Diego. We reserved a private room with dinner for our meeting. The meeting went extemely well due in part to Curtis Crawford, the Executive Chef, and his excellent staff. I highly recomend this hotel both for comfort and special meetings.

Reviews.Title: “great place: rooftop bar, cool staff and nice design”
Reviews.Author: rep01
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed there and they took good care of us, especially Curtis the Chef and Michelle the bartender upstairs. great views and dog-friendly place. We scored a nice group rate too. Much cooler place than the pricier big chain hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Amazing, Wonderful..LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Meg_Vancity
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is absolutely gorgeous! The room was wonderful, the bed was so comfortable, the location is perfect, the food is amazing at the restaurant! I would reccomend the 9th floor patio bar as it has stunning views, wonderful staff, flat screen tvs, beautiful fire places! I accidentally left my camera up there on Friday night and the staff left it with the front desk and it was returned to me before I had even noticed I had lost it! The location is perfect for shopping, eating out at all the amazing restaurants near by and there are sooo many options of great bars to visit within a minute walk! Although this hotel is stunning in appearance in all ways, nothing compares to its wonderful staff. One girl at the front desk, Peyton, who checked us in looked after us so well the whole time! She was wonderful, along with the rest of the staff there. So friendly and easy to chat with. It is so nice to feel like you can approach any one to ask a quesiton and they are so eager and happy to assist. Way to go guys. This is definitely one of the best hotels I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. THANKS!!

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay anywhere else, 5 star feel, 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: dspangle
Reviews.Content: I've attended an annual seminar at the SD convention center and found Indigo while looking for hotels that minimize their carbon footprint (I always feel wasteful when I travel). I was surprised it only had 3 stars compared to the overwhelmingly fake, awkward, and inconvenient "W" hotel. I watched Sunday football in the bright, airy lobby-bar and found great company with the attractive staff who had great advice for recreation, and shared interesting knowledge of the hotel and ball park. So great to meet such a well-trained team of young professionals like Peyton and David. I'll be back during Baseball season to experience the amazing view of Padres games from their terrace. Parking was a bit steep at $34, so I found a nearby pay lot to save cash to blow on the awesome nightlife. Card access for elevator was annoying, but I imagine it keeps out squatters during Padre games. The East Village location is the only place in the city free of dangerous looking characters, but still close to EVERYTHING. The MOD recommended a bowling alley for socializing, and it was surprisingly hip and a great place to meet people. Loved K-cup coffee ammenity, wished there were more caffinated pods. Ipads on the front desk were fun to use while planning out your excursions. Wont stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but don't expect to be looked after if you book through an agency!”
Reviews.Author: TheRichens2
Reviews.Content: All-in-all, indigo is pretty good hotel for the class and cost (if you get a deal through the likes of Skoosh, etc.) But for us there in lay the issue. Booked our queen/king room with city view through an agency at a reduced rate but contacted the hotel to ask for a king as we were staying as part of our honeymoon. Arrived to a poor room near the ice and vending machines with weak views that had two small queen beds. Immediately asked Dieter, the most surly receptionist I've ever had the misfortune of meeting, to move us but ge said it was an agency booking and wouldn't do anything about it. Tried to appeal his humane side by stressing we were honeymooning but he didn't have one! Other staff were laid back but friendly and the rooms were good for a three star. The location was only four blocks from the main action and the roof terrace bar was good. Breakfast was ok too if a bit small by US standards. So not bad overall, but sadly our friend on reception means we'll look elsewhere next time we're in this great town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, staff awesome, room...”
Reviews.Author: deltacode
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, staff awesome, room outstanding. I would rate as a 5* hotel, by far the best I've stayed in in the states.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: the4psta
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice! Everything is accessible - including beautiful runs / walks near the Convention Center and marina. Keefe at the front desk offered wonderful and professional service and the lobby bar is friendly and responsive. For those with allergies, be aware that the hotel DOES allow pets, though most of the floor was hardwood, so it should be OK for most. I'm allergic to cats and had no issues. Enjoy the food - there's a Nobu in walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: tfcn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new and in the perfect location for people who want to be within walking distance of everything in the Gaslamp Quarter! The hotel is clean and has a great little bar on the first floor with daily drink specials. There are also 2 computers to use free of charge which were great when you wanted to look something up that you wanted to do. The front desk was very helpful in recommending restaurants as well. Overall, the perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value without any negatives”
Reviews.Author: 89buckeye
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical when the price was significantly less than Embassy Suites, Marriott, Hilton, and Hyatt (at least $260) but was pleasantly surprised. Not cheap (avg. $170), but a great property. I had a room with 2 queen beds and they were very comfortable, the room was spacious as was the bathroom. Workout facility was adequate. At night the bar on floor 9 was a great place to look over Petco Park. The restaurant was good for breakfast and lunch, and drinks. Not really a dinner place. Not exactly the Gaslamp District (major stuff on 5th St.), but just a couple blocks away which makes it close but not too close to be loud. Safe and close to Gaslamp as well as a mix of good restaurants, sports bars, and of course Petco Park. Very pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: fshore
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for the Labor Day weekend. It was just perefect. It's located in the heart of the city, with just two blocks to either the Horton Center mall, Gaslamp Quarter, and the trolleys. Parking was easy to find on the street, so avoid paying extra $30 at the hotel. The hotel itself is brand new, and the rooms have super modern decor. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to my friends, and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY hotel I'll stay at in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: n0rland0
Reviews.Content: I travel down to San Diego once every two or three months to enjoy the sun during the day and to party it up in the Gaslamp at night. I like to stay close to the Gaslamp because everything is walking-distance and the only hotel that I'll stay at is the Hotel Indigo! First of all, you can't ask for a better location. From my hotel window, I could see clearly into Petco Park. A walk to the bars was less than 5 minutes, yet it was far enough so that I was never dodging night owls when I stepped outside. There was also a great coffee shop (pet friendly too!) called Java Jones that was less than a block away. When I walked in, I was greeted by one of the the pleasant staff members behind the counter. The hotel itself is beautiful. The contemporary decor - with its greens, blues, beige and orange - gives the hotel a comfortable yet upscale feeling. In the front lobby there was a waterfall display, couches where I lounged as I waited for my friends, a full bar with great original cocktails, and computers so I could check my email for free. I heard that they have live music at the hotel on certain nights and offer happy hour specials too. The rooms itself were clean and bright with hardwood floors. It's a huge plus that the hotel is pet friendly! The bed was nice, big shower w/ a wooden stool, Aveda bath products, flat screen TV, an iHome alarm clock so I could plug in my iPod, and a Keurig coffee maker. The Keurig is such a nice touch! An added bonus was also the free wifi in the hotel room. If I ever needed to go for a quick run on the treadmill, there was a gym with nice, new equipment and also an awesome outdoor patio with bar and fire pits. Honestly, I never spent more than 20 minutes in the gym, but spent all night at the outdoor bar/patio. I must say that the best part about the hotel is the staff. Everyone was very friendly and attentive. The last time, I brought my dog and the staff was so kind to him! They had water bowls for him outside and doggie treats for him to munch on. It was the first time that he had traveled away from home and apparently he wasn't keen on staying in the room alone. While I was out at Del Mar, I got a call from the front desk manager saying that his barking was causing our neighbor to file a noise complaint. With my permission, the front desk manager took my pooch out of the room and let him stay down at the front desk until I returned five hours later! He was as happy as a clam there! I'm not trying to advertise dogsitting services because the hotel doesn't offer it, but the fact that they went out of their way to calm him and their other guests truly made me and my dog feel special! They go ABOVE and BEYOND to ensure that their guests are happy and satisfied!!! I have never stayed anywhere where the staff goes beyond the call of duty like that. It is for this reason that I will only stay at the Indigo! Wonderful staff and a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing find!”
Reviews.Author: mikedpoway
Reviews.Content: A friend had mentioned that the Indigo was nice and dog friendly. What an understatement. I take my dalmation and my lady frequently and have been astounded as to how courteous and friendly the staff is. The food is amazing and the hotel bars just beautiful. The rooms are always amazing and the shower is beautiful. Highly reccomend trying this hotel. 5 stars all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Harmony177
Reviews.Content: Hotel smelled horrible!!! Hotel was beautiful to look at but will never stay there again due to the smell. Also, our key only worked for 24 hours at a time which forced us to go back to the desk everyday for a new one. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Value & Quality”
Reviews.Author: WorldAdventurer_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves its ranking. The staff was absolutely as friendly as they come. We were able to watch a baseball game from our room. The terrace bar is a great place to do the same. The lobby bar has great food and drink specials throughout the week. Gym was top-notch as were the in-room amenities. And all of this with the charming ambiance of a boutique hotel without the steep rates.

Reviews.Title: “Top 3 hotels we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: oldmace
Reviews.Content: I would rate the Indigo Hotel in San Diego as one of of the top 3 hotels we have stayed at in our 43 years of marriage. We went to visit our son, who lives there, and take in a Padres- Giants game. The hotel was way beyond what we hoped it would be. The ninth floor bar had a perfect view of Petco Park, it was located in a great district with bars and restaurants within walking distance, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the price was very fair. I distincely remember a gentleman who worked there that I could swear was there 24 hours a day The only thing we could find wrong was that the small refrigerator in our room was on the floor. Not that big a deal. We will stay there again when we visit our son and his friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A78
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in great location. Great room, great bed, very clean and quiet. They did not have free water, but there's 7-11 only a block away on 9th towards Petco Park. There's also a parking garage on 6th and Market, which is cheaper then hotel's valet parking. All the restaurants and nightlife in Gaslamp Quarter only few blocks away. USS Midway also close - long nice walk or a very short drive. I would also recommend checking out Altitude rooftop bar at the Marriott on 6th.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem for the party crowd, just not for families or people used to staff going the extra mile.”
Reviews.Author: alhan10
Reviews.Content: When we first walked into the lobby and then our room our first response was 'wow.' If the service could have been as good as the hotel this hotel would be outstanding. The staff is friendly enough but as helpful as smiling doorknobs. We were recommended a restaurant for lunch that was only open for dinner, despite numerous attempts to let them know we never received maid service...after the3rd attempt I finally asked if we could at least get fresh towels and they were brought up 45 minutes later at about 10:15pm. If you're travelling with kids and/or are used to superior service this probably isn't the hotel for you. If you're young and/or single with no kids you'll probably love it. It's definitely a party hotel on the weekends. We were on the 5th floor and could clearly hear the live band playing in the bar on the main floor. When asking about the restaurant recommendation for lunch and given the Mexican resturant that was not open for lunch, we were also told what great tequila shots the restaurant had...with my kids standing with me listening in....'party on dued....'

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DCD2212
Reviews.Content: The best of everything! Nice room, nice bar and nice food! Trendy but not obnoxious. Mixolist Adrianna is a treat and makes the best drinks ever! Ask for a higher floor or a view! City building are so close. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: Chiquitita
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations were a little high after reading some of the previous reviews, but I think some of my fellow TripAdvisors were a little too enthusiastic in their praise of this property. Having recently stayed at some of the Indigo's local competitors, I wouldn't be so quick to pick this property in the future over the others. The hotel is exceedingly well decorated in a trendy style that is comfortable despite its chic appearance. It's kind of like staying in a W Hotel without the attitude that sometimes accompanies a W stay. However, this hotel's management would do well to study some of what W Hotels do well in terms of offering friendly and personalized service. Parking is a real pain point. Because of the location immediately in front of Petco Park stadium and next to the Gaslamp quarter, street parking is often not an option. Meters run Mon-Sat until 6 pm and only allow 2-hour maximum stay. Garages and pay lots are available nearby but are no great bargain. This forces one to consider the $32 a night valet service. Unfortunately $32 doesn't buy very much in the service. I called down to the valet station to have my car pulled up (no direct line, must go through the Hotel operator) and didn't get an answer either time. The 2nd time this happened I complained to the front desk who promised to alert the valet to pull up my car. I came downstairs 10 minutes later and still waited 15 minutes for my car when I was in an awful hurry to get to a wedding. The valet manager was very unconvincing when he apologized and said that they were very busy - I was one of 2 people waiting for my car during this period. I ended up having that night's parking comped by the front desk manager. I also learned that the hotel uses an outside vendor for the parking service. I strongly recommend that they dump this vendor. The Phi Lounge on the 9th floor balcony is a beautiful spot with a great view into Petco Park stadium. Unfortunately the lounge was staffed by a single unsmiling drone bartender who do never left the back of the bar to take orders and needed me to repeat my order three times. The food in the lobby bar/lounge is very good - especially the sweet potato fries and sliders. The service was also marginally better here, possibly because it's in view of the front desk managers. The rooms are very comfortable and well insulated against outdoor noise. Having said that, the walls are a little thin and the echo of high heels from the 3 women staying in the next room on the parquet wood floor was annoying. Since I stayed on the top floor, I don't know if overhead noise from the wood floor is an issue for downstairs neighbors. The bathrooms are nicely decorated with a spacious shower. However, water pressure is a problem at times. I reported this to management and within 5 minutes an engineer visited my room and then went to reset a pump. This gave me enough pressure to shower, but I wouldn't ever recommend this hotel to someone who likes a good strong shower. There is no fridge in the rooms of any kind, however there are excellent Keurig one-cup coffee makers and safes in the room's closet. Check your bill really carefully upon checkout because mine still contained the parking charge for the night that was to have been comped. The bill was adjusted but the manager should have really taken care of that when he originally promised. Additionally, I was charged for a $5 water bottle placed in the room that I never touched. Overall, I'd call this hotel a 3-star hotel masquerading as a 4-star hotel. For a few dollars more a night, I'd prefer to stay at the W and be pampered a little.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: scoll82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights in August. Cannot recommend it highly enough. Very modern and stylish hotel in a great location. Staff very friendly and helpful, especially the valet guys who offer directions every time without even being asked. The 9th floor bar and terrace are a lovely place to enjoy an evening drink and overlook the baseball stadium. A short walk to Gaslamp bars and restaurants but still a very quiet area. The bar does great food and the rooms were top class also. The only tiny negatives are the price of the parking and the occassional delays for the elevators. Other than that we couldnt fault the place. One of the nicest hotels we've stayed in anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “"Hotel I want to INDIGO again!"”
Reviews.Author: alwyzbz1
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego for the International Fire Fighter Convention and stayed at Hotel Indigo. Our room wasn't ready for us when we arrived so we left our bags and went to check in at the convention and then to explore San Diego's Coronado Island. When we got back, we checked in but found our room not quite satisfactory. We were given another, even nicer without hesitation with a beautiful view of Petco Park. The room was big, clean and super comfortable for our weeks stay. The staff was very friendly and fun, very accommodating and very helpful with all of our requests for directions and cool fun places to see. We loved the location of this hotel as it was close to most of our activities and also close to public transportation when we ventured to the beach. We loved the open airy feel of this hotel and especially loved the bar on the 9th floor where we could enjoy watching the Padre game either through the glass or on the TV's. Out last night in San Diego we were kind of tired so we decided to grab a bite at the restaurant/bar. It was pretty busy and noisy but the food was delicious and we loved the interesting menu choices. We then ventured upstairs to the 9th floor bar to enjoy the game and met some really interesting people. The pet friendly atmosphere of the hotel was awesome even though we left our pups at home. We heard a lot of great comments though about Hotel Indigo's pet friendly environment. All in all, we had a wonderful week in San Diego and thoroughly enjoy our stay at the Hotel Indigo. Our only wish was that there was a pool on the roof or deck for us to enjoy. Thanks to all that made our stay so homey and inviting!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: luvtheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a Padres game. Can't beat the location. Pretty public spaces and nice 9th-floor terrace-bar, pleasant staff. Hip ambiance. I rate conservatively, so even with 3 stars we enjoyed our stay. Good news if traveling with pets -- they take pets, with no service charge or deposit. Hey, it's next to Petco Park! The rooms reflect the rest of the hotel -- modern, spacious, clean. Beautiful hardwood floor. Nice bathroom with big shower. Weak-flushing "green" toilet. No full-length mirror (or maybe I missed it). Elaborately made-up beds, with heavy spreads and big throw pillows and a writing tray on one, need a turn-down service. No individual bedside lamps. Rather strange placement of rug partially under one bed and reading chair. No room safe, but that doesn't bother me much these days with card-key rooms and strong doors. No fridge with ridiculously priced drinks and snacks, but any fridge would have been nice. 24/7 breakfast/snacks room service, which we didn't use, so can't rate. Excellent interior and exterior noise insulation. Two elevators are a bit overwhelmed for a crowded hotel. A line extended into the lobby for the long wait. $32 a night for parking is pretty exorbitant. The shortcomings are easy to live with. This is a good place to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Great service, Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LittleMsSunshine2010
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in San Diego & stayed two nights at Hotel Indigo in the Gaslamp Quarter area. We parked the car & walked everywhere the entire weekend except for a short drive to the zoo. Hotel is in the perfect location to walk to restraunts, Seaport Village, & several coffee shops for a morning coffee! We found a great rate online & will definitely stay here again. Valet service & front desk service was outstanding! Hotel valet parking is alittle high ($32) so we did move the car to a cheaper overnight structure ($12) only a block from the hotel. No swimming pool, but hotel rooms & service makes up for that! And beachs are only a short drive. We stayed in a corner room & had a perfect view of the Padres baseball stadium. Hotel staff recommended The Broken Yoke for breakfast along with a coupon & it was wonderful. Large menu selection & great atmosphere...& only a short walk!

Reviews.Title: “Right by Petco Park and the Gaslamp, but still quiet!!”
Reviews.Author: orange-u-tall
Reviews.Content: An unbelievably comfortable bed, a spacious bathroom, a great location, the accolades of the Hotel Indigo were seemingly endless. The hotel felt "boutique", but it was still on the larger side. It had a nice lobby bar/restaurant with local microbrews on tap. Restaurants are easy to find nearby, as are nice bars and of course, Petco Park, home of the San Diego Padres. Although the area is rather bustling, it was nice to get a peaceful night of sleep. The hotel is amazingly quiet for its locale.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Hip, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: gilp12
Reviews.Content: Modern, new, and efficient rooms. The hardwood floors are a nice touch. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The gym had only a minimal amount of equipment, although it was clean and well kept. The rooms are a decent size, not small but not huge (maybe 300 square feet). This hotel is technically rated a 3.5* - likely because it does not have a pool - but I would say that it should be more like 4 or 4.5*. Location is 4 short blocks away from the main part of the gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and well located”
Reviews.Author: Tommie69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and were pleased with our choice. The hotel is very modern (although the rooms are a little dark) and comfortable. There was an acoustic guitar group playing on Thursday night in the lobby area which was good. The hotel is very well located for the Gas Lamp district which really buzzes at night with a great range of bars and restaurants. We were also able to go to Padres baseball match which was fun (alternatively you can watch it from the hotel rooftop bar). We didn't have a car but we were able to find our way around the tram and bus system and it was cheap only $9 for a 2 day unlimited pass. Several of the stops are nearby. The only downside was that there was not an inroom safe - we assumed that all hotels in cities would have this facility nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dsuar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo was comfortable, fun, and close to all activities in downtown SD. Staff was friendly and facilities were nice. It was a bit pricey, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: fishgirl20
Reviews.Content: Thought it was a really fantastic hotel, felt like I was the first person to stay in my room - everything was so fresh and spotless. Super comfortable. Good location for walking to attractions. Rental car office close by for day trips and I found on street parking, also close to trolley lines.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel that caters to pets although I only saw one”
Reviews.Author: WesCovington
Reviews.Content: I took my fiancee here for her birthday on a weekend. I picked the place in part because I liked the decor and it advertised itself as being pet friendly. Although we didn't take our pets, we figured we would see plenty of others. But, we only saw one. Nevertheless, the hotel was very nice and the staff was very friendly. There was a marathon going on in the morning and we were informed right away but what the traffic impact would be and what the noise would be like. I was woken up by the noise from the race, but my fiancee slept right through it. Although we had to valet the car, the attendants brought it out very quickly. There are a lot of places to dine around the hotel, although we ate outside the Gaslamp Quarter. If there had been a Padres home game, I could have watched it from the room. But i wouldn't have been able to see any balls hit into left and right field.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best pet-friendly hotel I have ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: bordermic
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write about a very unique and wonderful experience I had while staying at Hotel Indigo San Diego... while at Seaworld, I received a phone call from the hotel... seems that my dog Angel had escaped from my hotel room. According to the front desk clerk, Dieter, he saw her get off the elevator and run towards the lobby doors. She ran through them and down the street crossing two major throughfares to PETCO stadium park. The Dieter ran after her. He finally caught up with her in a Seven-Eleven convenience store and brought her back to the hotel. He locked her up in a sales office however she managed to open THAT door a couple of times before I arrived. Needless to say, I was amazed and astonished that: 1. She opened the door to my room. Now anyone that knows Angel knows that she can open my doors at home. However, didn't THINK that she could manage a commercial hotel room door! 2. She got into the elevator and was able to make it downstairs. The front desk clerks watched the security video tape and said that she went straight to the elevator banks and waited until the doors opened. The big question is: HOW DID SHE HIT THE DOWN BUTTON??? 3. Angel and I had just gone to Petco Stadium that morning for a walk and had stopped in the 7-11 store to get a drink. Guess she thought I was still there! 4. Last but certainly not least, she managed NOT to get run over in busy San Diego traffic! She has become quite the sensation around here at Hotel Indigo... I'm just hoping to get her back to Colorado in one piece. And now a BIG plug for this hotel: everyone here has bent over backwards for me and Angel... they love dogs here and completely cater to them. I would encourage anyone who has pets (and even if you don't) to try out this hotel the next time you visit San Diego. Not only is it a beautiful hotel in a great part of town but they certainly go out of their way to take care of their guests!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place. Great decor and free...”
Reviews.Author: customized
Reviews.Content: Loved the place. Great decor and free wifi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “We paid $400 a night for a room during...”
Reviews.Author: Judeobscur58
Reviews.Content: We paid $400 a night for a room during Comic Con. Which is a lot. The room is very basic and nowhere near - not even in the same universe as - worth that price. The beds are hard. None of the "standard rooms" on levels 2-5 have tubs. No robes. No mini fridge. And you can hear kids running down the hall upstairs. It looks like luxe in the pics - but that's lipstick on a pig. I say stick to the Marriott or Hyatt. Far nicer for same or less price.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Staff, Solid Location for SD Downtown”
Reviews.Author: juls33
Reviews.Content: I was transferred here from the Hilton for the first night because they were overbooked. Didn't know what to expect as I had not heard of it before--discovered a brand newly constructed building, amongst a clusted of handsome, modern housing complexes right around the corner from the main drag of the Gaslamp District. I have to say, for a boutique hotel, I have seen better. The quality of the finishes, plan layout, were mediocre, though I am very much into design and hip hotels so I am fussier than some. However, for a hotel in the area, the rooms are spacious, tasteful, complete, with fine toiletries and the works. It was noisy, though, there was sound leakage coming from unknown places, and they have to remedy this somehow. The location is perfect, walking distance to the main drag, on a pleasant , very energetic part of town. What sets them apart, however, was their honesty and integrity. I had left an expensive watch on the bed upon checkout and discovered it was missing half a day later. They were too busy to check up on housekeeing the entire afternoon, but at night, one of the guys called me up to say they had located it and that I can pick it up anytime. I have to say, in my mind, I was ready to let the watch go, hoping it will benefit someone's useful life (sarcastically speaking), but was delightfully surprised to have found that housekeeping acted responsibly and did the right thing. So for this, I give them 5 stars. Didnt try their restaurant, but it has a wonderful facade, opening almost entirely to the street. Also, they have a pleasant rooftop bar, which I thought was rather chic.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer045
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay at the Hotel Indigo. The staff were all very friendly, we arrived early and our room was ready so we were able to check in. The room was spacious and bright and beautifully decorated in a modern style - we loved all the pillows on the bed! The bathroom was also huge and very modern with nice complimentary toileteries. The lobby was also large and modern, with a bar and restaurant one side and a lounge area with computers (for guests use - free of charge) on the other. We used the valet parking, which was expensive ($32 per night) but so convenient. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from the gaslamp district, where there are loads of bars and restaurants to choose from. We went to the hotel bar (which has great happy hour deals and every 1st Tuesday of the month is dog happy hour - you can bring your dog - so funny!) and to a steak house around the corner called Cowboy Star, which was recommended by the hotel and was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Gaslamp Indigo”
Reviews.Author: jconviser
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in San Diego for a week and stayed at the Indigo. We chose it because we were familiar with the Indigo in Boston and knew it to be a cool and hip hotel. Unfamiliar with San Diego on the map it looked like it was pretty close to the convention center where she had a conference. Overall my expectations were exceeded. The location was about a block from Petco Park and a short walk to the Gaslamp district (lots of bars, restaurants, formerly home to 75 brothels-that was 50 years ago) and the Convention Center. This part of town was interesting. The hotel was great and only a couple years old however it was next to a small two story building that said "Hotel" on it. This place looked like it has been abandoned 40 years ago and it probably should have been. This part of town is still a work in process and there are many hotels just like this one. Apparently they were flop houses used by sailors back during WW ll and prior. Despite this the area felt very safe and we did a lot of walking around there but be prepared because this part of town was pretty seedy. The hotel it self was very good. Very clean and extremely modern. The ninth floor has a great deck with bar from which you can peer into Petco Park. The rooms while not large are big enough and very comfortable. Again very modern with plasma tvs, great bed, big bathrooms etc. The front desk staff was exceptional. They could not have been more helpful. A couple of them especially Peyton and David were outstanding.They offered lots of great suggestions on the best way to explore the city. They really made us feel at home greeting us by name when we walked in the door each evening. The staff is the primary reason I am writing this review and why I am so glad I stayed at the Indigo. I suggest you stay there too and say "hello" to Peyton!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel brand!”
Reviews.Author: LAtravelguy90028
Reviews.Content: I want to move here and become a general manager!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely”
Reviews.Author: ttara
Reviews.Content: I loved that the floors were hardwood and the decor of the hotel and the rooms were quite nice and comfortable. Loved that they have Aveda toiletries. Wish there was a bath/shower combo but that was minor as we were only staying for two nights and the glass shower worked fine. Great water pressure and maid service. Room service was okay - wish they had more of a selection but we survived. The location is great for those going to the Padres games - you don't even have to buy a ticket! Just look out the window! I loved that the windows opened to let in fresh air. It did get chilly one night and the heat didn't appear to come on so we just turned the fan off of the auto selection. Great location as it's walking distance to the Gaslamp district though the best pizza we had was at Basic nearby. Valet is a bit pricey but I'm sure there were other options. We just didn't have the time so search for those. The Starbucks on Market and Tenth was the worst one I'd been to as they didn't seem attentive at all to drink orders and only moderately friendly. Good thing there were tons nearby. Oh, the rooms have a the Kreuig coffee machines but no milk or sweetners that I could see. No fridges in the room either. Great wifi and the television was fine. Would love to know who makes their bedding as it was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “great room with a view”
Reviews.Author: ob23
Reviews.Content: stayed here for my birthday on the 4th of july weekend and this hotel did not disappoint!! we were able to check in super early (9:30am!!). had reserved a corner exec room with view of petco park. we had room 1114 and it was awesome, great decor, fantistic views from walls of windows. bathroom was very nice and very large. had to call down twice to have towels replaced that were taken from our room when cleaned but that was the only service complaint. the bartender/server on the terrace was the nicest ever, just couldn't do enough for us. after i made my reservations for this hotel, i found out that it was very dog friendly. i'm not a big dog person so i thought this might be a problem with barking dogs and what not. it wasn't at all. other than leshed dogs in the lobby and a few people who decided it was great fun to watch them run around on the terrace, it was not an issue for those of us who didn't have four legged friends. it was a little noisey in our room from the 9th floor terrace, but if your room is not directly above the terrace, you should have no issue. also, regarding location, this is san diego and if you are familiar with the city you know there are alot of homeless people most of whom are completely harmless. this hotel is about 3 blocks from a large concentration of homeless due to the services nearby. the nearest trolley stop is market and park and the walk to and from can be a little dicey in my opinion. on the plus side, it is so easy to get everywhere else from this hotel. walked to seaport village to watch fireworks, to the field for a guinness and to the ballpark for a game. just the perfect trip, thank you hotel indigo for a great birthday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vtxriders
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have stated, it is NOT in the heart of the Gaslamp District. It sits at the edge of the Gaslamp District and East Village. However, it is a great location and is off the main Gaslamp streets which means it is a little more quiet. Yes, it may be a few more blocks to walk but it is VERY walkable. I was visiting for a convention at the San Diego Convention Center and while there were a lot of hotels closer, I enjoyed the exercise. I always felt safe and never worried about anything on my walks. The hotel itself is very nice and the staff very friendly. The rooms clean and spacious. We did not eat in the hotel as there are so many great restaurants in the area. Too many to experience during the week that we were there. Parking, on the other hand, is quite expensive but isn't every city?

Reviews.Title: “Modern and confortable, perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: cyansand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in San Diego for my birthday last weekend. It was a bit last minute so many of the hotels in our preferred neighborhood (Gaslamp) were already booked. I found a good deal online, however, for Hotel Indigo and the price was right so we gave it a shot. Boy are we glad we did. As far as service goes, we were very pleased. Everything from the prompt valet service to the friendly front desk. The bellhop who was full of information about the hotel and the neighborhood. They were all helpful w/o being overbearing. One thing that did irk us a bit - we came in late that first night and decided to order from the 24 hour room service. Apparently 11PM was too late after all since the kitchen was out of everything. Location is great. Just a couple blocks from the noisy/fun area of the gaslamp. So you're near the fin but you won't have the partying keep you up at night. The hotel is modern... by that I mean - aesthetics are clean and contemporary in an artistic way rather than a bland Marriot sort of way and amenities you expect are right there, like easy access to wi-fi . Overall we had a great time and highly recommend. Here are a few additional quick snippets of our thoughts: + dog friendly, big plus for us + 9th floor balcony is great. Awesome view of the city and Petco Park as well as firepits and a bartender +nice TVs - beds are a bit hard - expensive valet - food at the downstairs restaurant is merely okay. To be fair we only had breakfast there, and really who cares since you're in the gaslamp area anyways.

Reviews.Title: “It got worse each day”
Reviews.Author: foodwinethee
Reviews.Content: The location was out of the way from anything remotely interesting or convenient. Each day, the service (or lack thereof) was worse in the 3 nights I stayed. Room service never answered the phone, and I would have to call front desk each time to order breakfast. The tray arrived without silverware, napkin, cream or cup. One day, they never even cleaned the room, even though I left at 7:30 a.m. and put the sign on the door to clean. Very few amenities and no service at all.

Reviews.Title: “You could not ask for a friendlier place near everything Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: jgarciajr45
Reviews.Content: A few friends, my girlfriend, and my bulldog spent memorial weekend in San Diego. Having graduated from San Diego State, I knew Gaslamp was where I wanted to be. Also, there were four scheduled Padre home games during our stay from Friday 5/28/2010 through Monday 5/31/2010 so the hotel had to be walking distance from the stadium making this hotel ideal. When making our room reservations, I happened to speak with the front desk supervisor. Dieter, was very helpful and his age (around my 26) made his suggestions perfect for a great night out. Upon arriving, the curb service was great with our bags and our dog. Among all the great Bell serviceman, Sergio was the most notable. He greeted our dog daily with the affection only dog lovers provide. Although I'm not as influenced by dog treats as my bulldog, Sergios friendliness quickly provided a sense of comfort as if we were guests at his own home. He even informed me of great places for doggy business within and around the hotel. Our rooms were amazing! The view of PETCO Park from the window was so perfect that I didn't have to go to the stadium to watch any games. Both rooms reserved had the same view of the stadium, were comfortably furnished with two queen beds, and side by side on the 8th floor. Conveniently located just below the 9th floor patio where we were informed a section of grass was available for dog business. Monica, also of the front desk, made it effortless catching a cab every time one was needed. She was also very friendly with conversation while waiting for the rest of the group to make it down to the lobby. Monica was also very helpful recommending what to order for room service. The hotel was perfect! No overwhelming trendy design. Close enough to walk to the scene but far enough to be away. Aside from the water bowl out front, the hotel was maintained so clean that you would not know it was dog friendly. From check-in to check-out, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff made our stay seem effortless. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a great time in the San Diego area. Amazing people providing amazing service for an amazing hotel! I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at Indigo”
Reviews.Author: evebenton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Indigo for 9 days and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is new and LEED certified. The staff are terrific and so helpful. Dieter Schmitz, the front desk manager, was so helpful and catered to our every need. The beds were exceptional. So comfortable. All the other front desk staff were also terrific and responsive. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone going to San Diego. The location is so convenient and walkable to everything. It was fun to watch the Padres game from our window too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good! nice hotel ,”
Reviews.Author: THELAKESDr
Reviews.Content: Great Location, 1 block from petco park, nice staff, simple good bistro food i love it !!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: kathg
Reviews.Content: San Diego is a very spread out city so work out where you want to stay. Hotel Indigo is right by the baseball stadium, and as we went there twice it was the perfect option. There's some very cool bars in the vicinity and was perfect for morning runs along the arena for my husband. The hotel is very modern, clean and the rooms are really nice and confortable. The only problem i had was the expensive car parking ontop of the already pricey hotel room. If you're ok with paying 35USD on top of your USD250 a night room then its a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a convenient location for Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: scubadiver5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of June. Very helpful check in staff who managed us an early check- in and a complementary upgrade. Room was very stylish, with all the amenities we needed ( very tasty in room coffee) and a large bathroom with walk in shower. Views from outdoor terrace bar into Petco park were great and nice to see the hotel allowed dogs. Special mention to the guys on the concierge/bellhop desk. They were great and always willing to offer suggestions and opinions on bars/restaurants etc. Parking fee a little on the steep side, but a minor niggle

Reviews.Title: “Nice Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spreese
Reviews.Content: Okay, first we live in a DC, so San Diego in a typical west coast fashion seems slow and laid back....so this hotel is quiet if you know what a loud city is like. It is conveniently located to all San Diego has to offer and literally right by PETCO field if you are a baseball fan. Coronado Island is ten mins away and the interstate is 5 mins away that gets you everywhere. The room is nice, clean, and a little funky which is what we like. We have no complaints and would definitely stay here again. Of course there is valet parking fee that seems expensive if you are from the midwest...but you are staying downtown in a major California city.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean, comfortable... great service, frindly staff.”
Reviews.Author: wesseat
Reviews.Content: nice place. would stay again. great proximity to petco park. you can see the field from the ninth floor deck.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Indigo”
Reviews.Author: scain7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Indigo memorial day weekend. We arrived around 3:30pm. Room not quite ready so desk comped 2 drinks for my wife and I at the bar while waiting for room. I thought this was a very nice gesture. And we only had to wait about 5 minutes for room. Hotel Indigo is decorated in "Urban Chic" motif, so the colors are bright and modern. Each room has wood floors which I really liked. The Hotel is in a great location and some rooms have a view of PETCO baseball stadium. I noticed that most of the guests staying at this hotel were young couples and handsome/pretty. So don't bring your kids to this hotel...its more for a getaway for couples. The only thing I didn't like was the mandatory 32.00 for valet parking....but it wasn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, still a few issues to work out”
Reviews.Author: ipushbuttons
Reviews.Content: For the price the Indigo is a great bargin.The decor through out was great. Nice bar and lobby. The rooms were comfortable. Located in a great area in the gaslamp. The only problem I had was with my room on the first night. We were given a room directly under the 24hr gym. Who knew people worked out from midnight until 6am? The front desk staff was very helpful and was able to move us for the second night of our stay. I would stay there again, provided the room location was better. Also the parking is a bit steep, however I booked from the hotel website, and there was a considerable discount in parking with a "package deal".

Reviews.Title: “Still working out some of the kinks in a new niche hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Emmy_and_family
Reviews.Content: There's a lot to like about this hotel, but we had the impression that the management and staff are still working out some of the kinks in a relatively new establishment. Thereâ€™s a lot in the hotelâ€™s literature about how â€œchicâ€�, â€œsophisticatedâ€� and â€œinâ€� it is, and although my own preference would be for less self-conscious glorification of trendiness, it is a beautifully decorated hotel with fresh bright linens on the beds, interesting light fixtures and paint, and large and gorgeous bathrooms. Still on the positives, we ate breakfast in the Phi restaurant twice and were favorably impressed with the service. On the other hand, staff training in some other areas needs some work. I found the front desk staff only minimally polite, a bit supercilious, even. This is unfortunate, since first impressions count for a lot and I want to feel that if I have to talk to the front desk staff about a problem, that they will be motivated to put it right. But after all, this is just my subjective impression and maybe some guests prefer a more aloof demeanor than I do. More seriously, our rooms were not thoroughly cleaned. For example, when we arrived in the room I sat down in the armchair and moved the footstool a few inches. What should I see but a wadded up used Kleenex on the floor that the housekeeping staff had missed? Yuck. Another housekeeping problem: the rooms had beautiful high-end coffee makers, but neither of our two rooms had a complete set of coffee making materials the first morning we woke up in the hotel. We had coffee in one room, but had to raid the coffee tray in the kids' room next door to get cream and sugar for my husband, who doesn't like black coffee. That was okay I suppose, since we had two rooms and could combine the supplies, although we would expect better in this class of hotel. But then after the housekeeping staff had serviced the rooms later that day, we found they had not cleaned the coffee maker or the cups, nor had they replenished the coffee, cream, or sugar in either room. So we werenâ€™t able to use the coffee maker the second morning we were in the hotel. Housekeeping also didn't wash or replace the glasses we had used. Again, it wasnâ€™t the end of the world, but this is not a low-budget hotel and I expected better service for what we paid. This isn't a criticism, more an observation: families with young children do not appear to be a demographic that this hotel is targeting. We noted that while dogs were welcome in the restaurant, it didn't have a children's menu. We managed to find things on the menu everyone in our family could eat at breakfast, since our kids are old enough to do justice to adult portions and choices. But a few years ago nothing on the restaurant's menu would have been appealing to them, especially for lunch and dinner. All in all, this is an interesting hotel and it may be a great choice for some people. But we found the housekeeping lapses were worrying and we weren't impressed enough to want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel NOT for families”
Reviews.Author: Jesille
Reviews.Content: Got the room for $92 from hotwire.com. 3 things to be aware of when booking with hotwire: they do not inform you that there is a $32 valet , NO room service (they do but just hummus) and that you will get a room looking out to what looks to be there electrical room. The location was literally a few steps away from PETCO park. I can see the stadium from the lobby. Unfortunately, my room was filled with little creatures. First killed a spider on my bed then my hubby tried to get the large moth on the wall (dont know where it went after that). There were a lot of dogs checking in when I came so I will assume they are pet friendly. The rooms are medium sized, decor was ok, hard wood floors felt wierd because Im not use to stepping on a cold floor in my bedroom, the little carpet they had looks to have pet hair and there is no movies on demand just plain channels. Anyway, long story short, I dont think Ill be back even for $92.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: systemsanalyst
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel by accident and were glad we did. It was clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was unusually large and the view spectacular. There was a problem with the shower, which was fixed quickly. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Decor!”
Reviews.Author: YouHadMeAtMerlot
Reviews.Content: We arrived early after travelling 12 hours and were happy to see that our room was ready and we could go up and freshen up. The Bell Hop was pleasant and took the time to ask us if we had any questions and answered them all. Each employee of the Hotel Indigo truly went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The rooftop lounge overlooking the Petco Park, though small, is a great spot for before dinner drinks with a view! The bartender came down and ended up becoming our server for dinner and made our meal a pleasure. And, last, but not least, the room itself was fun and funky, yet more than comfortable which is not always true of "boutique hotels" in other locales. Started off our vacation on a fantastic note!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rawdogg
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice Hotel. I do not understand the few bad reviews. Hotel was clean and a nice location. Love the Adult shower for two :). We had a room on the 5th floor and the view was great of the city. Rooms were nice size. I would stay here once again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: pmcginn
Reviews.Content: Went to hotel Indigo because of tripadvisor.com reviews. Found unfailing cheerfulness from the desk and the car valets. After our first night i asked the desk if we had perhaps been upgraded, but no. Our standard room was very large and handsome in design with lots of light and an armchair to read in. Great bathroom. too. FYI we were easily 40 years older than the average guest but it seemed to make no difference. A Gem.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: appleicecream
Reviews.Content: I went to Hotel Indigo to celebrate a friends 21st Birthday. Of all the hotels i stayed in Gaslamp, Hotel Indigo has the most spacious and well decorated rooms. the wallpaper, bedsheets and furniture were all beautiful. There was a great view of the city. The hardwood floors were odd, but did not bother us at all. It may have bothered the guests downstairs when we walked around in heels though. The fact that it is a green hotel was a plus and no ammenities were compromised because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Pet Friendly Addition to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: BCSInsider
Reviews.Content: The feeling at Indigo is fresh and new.
