The staff have yet to settle into a rhythm (the front desk didn't have a key for the cash drawer and seemed a little distressed) and could be a little bit more personable, but were professional and courtesous. The 9th Floor bar was cozy with the fire tables, but I didn't appreciate using a short plastic cup for my $11/glass of wine. The best aspect of Indigo were the canines that seemed right at home. A good option for people who travel with their pets.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience & I can't wait to do it again.”
Reviews.Author: Roquemama
Reviews.Content: Decided to be a tourist in my own city for a day. When I saw East Village I was a little nervous at first, but it is not too east thank goodness. This hotel was walking distance to everything we wanted to do. It was very modern and clean and I wish we would have had more time to enjoy the 9th floor views. I agree with all of the positives on this site. The one negative I saw that can be true is the noisy part. We were in a corner room and the vent in the restroom can tunnel noise in, like sirens. We could also hear a bit more hallway traffic but not so much that we were annoyed at all. The bed was super cozy and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “We will be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: SoQu
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here with our two dogs. We were impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff. The decor was clean, modern and comfortable. We enjoyed relaxing over drinks and appetizers on the Phi Terrace on the ninth floor. The food was very good. The rooms had Keurig coffee (pod) makers which we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for convention center”
Reviews.Author: The_Upholsterer
Reviews.Content: My wife had a conference at the convention center in February and we booked last minute through Hotwire. Hotwire.com rated the hotel as a 4 star in the San Diego Gaslamp District. This is perfect if you are going to a Padres game since the stadium is a two minute walk away. The Convention center is a ten minute walk away. 5th Ave, the heart of the Gaslamp District, is a five minute walk away. My wife felt safe walking around on her own which is extremely important to us. The only negative of this hotel was the price of parking, but it is decent considering the parking price of other nearby hotels. My wife's Itouch was able to access the free wifi, but I couldn't connect with my Iphone. I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean and First Rate”
Reviews.Author: MfW31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. New hotel. Very comfortable rooms and first rate amenities. I liked the clean, uncluttered style, and the staff were great. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wrongly Billed as a Four-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sweets4dasweet
Reviews.Content: Cute boutique feel. Check. Great location. Check. Modern decor. Double check. And this concludes the positive descriptor portion of this review. I think someone had the right idea, but I don't think they truly took time to understand what it truly means to offer four-star amenities. For example, what hotel (2-star hotels included) does not provide on-demand offerings? Can someone, PLEASE tell me? The LaQuinta Inn perhaps? I've seen more choices on the menu of a high-school cafeteria. The menu is sparse. When you FINALLY decide on something to eat, you realize you've just spent a grip on a sample - at best. When it comes to toiletries, I don't know if the hotel is cheap or what, but you will come up short with towels, soap and such. Perhaps this is something that most hotels don't seem to get, but if you have TWO people staying in a room, it would be nice to provide for TWO. Also, it would be nice if they took time to clean the shower. The beds are not the most comfortable. However, this is relative. In summary, it's not the worst hotel. I would not say that. But, to claim to be a four-star hotel is a stretch. It takes more than pretty sheets and curtains. While four-star is NOT five-star, it does provide service offerings. The hotel is in a great location. The card-key ran elevator does provide a safe feeling atmosphere. However, they need to make sure all the basics are covered.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the noisest rooms on the Planet!”
Reviews.Author: cheezew
Reviews.Content: If you have a choice stay somewhere else. They allow large barking dogs, the walls are paper thin, and you can even hear casual conversation next door. If your neighbor comes in late and plays music you are toast. The floors are nice hard wood, But they pickup every footstep. You can hear every door in the hotel slam, no matter where you are located. The rooms are nice and clean, but the noise makes up for any good things the Hotel has to offer. I would not retutn to this Hotel at any price. No wonder they are listing on Hotwire during Spring Break... Stay clear..Trust me! Parking a hidden 32 dollars anight.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great!”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is great. The rooms are very big, the baths are huge, the bed is super comfortable and the staff isn't just good, they're fun. The ninth floor has a great rooftop deck and the lobby bar is a very nice place to start or end your evening. There are at least 100 restaurants and pubs within a five minute walk and you're just up the street from the Padre's stadium. Imagine a bright and cheerful W, with much bigger rooms, that's the Indigo. The only thing I didn't care for was the band they had in the lobby bar Thursday night. Too loud for the setting, didn't fit the hotel mood or style. Great Mac's in the lobby for your use, free. Did I mention the price? Hundreds less than what I have paid for a comparable hotel. Even with valet parking, $35 per night, it's a steal! This hotel was perfect for our stay and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Always Love Hotel Indigo - did not dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: MrsSnow
Reviews.Content: We love Hotel Indigo and stay at them whenever possible. Love the how modern it is! And love the hardwood floors rather than nasty carpet. Bathrooms are always very clean and modern and love the Aveda products. This location did not dissapoint. The downsides of this location is that the only parking is $32 valet partking (daily). We did not mind since my company was paying for it. Also, the cleaning habits were a bit odd. The first day, they didn't come by until 6:30pm and by that point we said forget it, and the other two days they came before noon (we were gone) but they never did return the room to how it was originally, and that kind of bothered me. They didn't put back on the throw pillows, they didn't return trays or appliances to the original places, and they didn't put the ironing board up. A small inconvenience, but I just found it a bit odd. However, I would definitely stay here again. The location was perfect!!! Easy walking distance to Petco park, and the Gaslamp district. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: rklace
Reviews.Content: I just loved the contemporary and clean decor of this hotel. Our room was beautiful and the Aveda amenities a nice touch. Check-in was excellent. A girlfriend and I who are mothers and were having our first trip together in over a decade were really looking forward to one night away. We were upgraded to a nicer room and all was going smoothly. Unfortunately, there was a party next door until 2:00 a.m. and I awoke with the worst headache and I rarely get headaches. Upon check-out I mentioned that there had been a very loud party and that we didn't get very good sleep and the young woman at the front desk who was nowhere near as hospitable as the older women upon check-in said "Well, this is a downtown hotel and it was Saturday night." Having been in the hospitality industry myself I was a bit surprised by this response and did not want to leave on a bad note so I didn't say anything further. So, would we recommend this hotel? Yes, but if you are wanting a restful night's sleep, one of the main reasons people check into pricey hotels, then you might want to request a room in a less occupied section of the hotel or next to a non-twenty something or blocked room for unknown guests. As far as the front desk agent who checked us out...I don't think she has a long-term career in this industry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: VeryBusyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I just got back from San Diego participating in a business conference at the Grand Hyatt. I couldn't get a room at the Hyatt so I was forced to other options. Our office administrator booked me at the Hotel Indigo. I had no previous experience and was very pleasantly surprised. In general I like staying at boutique-style hotels versus sprawling mega properties, and the Hotel Indigo really hit the mark. It is trendy, yes, but tastefully done, not a haphazard collection of off-beat furnishings. I stayed in a very affordable king bed standard room; plenty of room and a very nice bathroom. I'm a business traveler and enjoy good service, free wi-fi and a clean look and feel. The Hotel Indigo scored high on all fronts. It is also priced very well for the market, but suspect once travelers begin returning and their occupancy increases, they will demand higher room rates. I saw earlier comments about kid-friendly. I would not think that familes with small children would find the Hotel Indigo a great option given all the comments about refrigeratiors and microwaves, etc. This is more a couples or older teens and/or business traveler destination.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but could be nicer....”
Reviews.Author: Tara360
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel very much but did find a couple of areas for improvement. I found the valet parking to be expensive at $32.00 per night. There is no self parking and parking does seem to be an issue in that area. I also thought the hotel should have offered a complimentary continental breakfast. It would have been a nice touch. The rooms are very comfortable. The only problem with the room is that the doors are equipped with very heavy locking mechanisms making it impossible to close the door quietly. The loud clanking can be heard down the hall. The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: clbb
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Large, beautiful suite with separate living room, big bathroom and extremely comfortable bed. Excellent closet space. Furnishings very hip and trendy. Excellent location. Above all, fantastic staff. Everyone at reception went above and beyond to take care of everything from the moment we checked in until we left. Always greeted by name and very concerned about our needs being met. Have stayed in many hotels in San Diego and would choose Hotel Indigo above all others. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel near the ballpark”
Reviews.Author: schpyda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for president's day weekend, saturday - monday. The hotel staff was very nice, when we checked in they told us about happy hour up on the rooftop bar, and gave us a coupon. This brought the drink prices down to normal from absurd, but hey -- rooftop bar, right? The hotel is very pet friendly, and we saw many well-behaved dogs during our stay. We didn't get room service, but the menu looked pretty good. The room itself was nice, a king-sized bed, flat-screen TV, standard desk / chair / ottoman configuration. The bathroom had a giant shower with a wooden sitting stool in it, but no tub. Most of the room was hardwood (or fake hardwood, not sure, but not carpet), which was nice, but not cold to walk around on. The neighborhood itself is very walkable, close to coffee shops, restaurants, and clubs. Parking seemed pretty overpriced at $32/night for valet, but we were fine getting street parking. Overall, I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Basset_Mom
Reviews.Content: We were in town for conference, where my company put us up at the Omni. I could not afford the prices to continue our stay @ the Omni. When we moved over to the Indigo, I was not looking forward to moving to a new location, thinking the Indigo would be a downgrade from where we stayed for the convention. This was NOT the case at all! We were thrilled when we checked into the Indigo and got to our room, it was beautiful. This new trendy & super clean hotel is a must stay for San Diego travelers. It is located on quiet 9th street, a few blocks from Petco Park & a few more blocks from the hustle & busy restaurants on 5th Ave. The staff was very helpful and pleasant.. The room was sleek, sophisicated & gave us a feeling of being at home. The roof top bar with flat screen TV's and 2 large firepits, was a great place to watch the Superbowl. We ate at the restaurant one morning for a yummy breakfast. A nice 7-11 convenient store is just a block away for anything you may need. This hotel was reasonable priced & we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best $72 Hotwire Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: punkleg
Reviews.Content: Got this for $72 on Hotwire and took it over the $85 4.5 star hotel (this was 4 stars) because of the Trip Advisor rating. This hotel is only 1 year old and everything is new, very clean, and hip. The rooms are very well designed and the King Bed was huge and great. Once you get the hotel on Hotwire for $72 then you sign up for their "Priority One" frequent traveler program for free and the hotel will upgrade you to a better room even on the day of your arrival like they did for me and gave me $10 free minibar coupons. Excellent value. This hotel was going for $200 a night on the Indigo website the same day I got it for $72 on Hotwire. San Diego is hurting economically and there should be plenty of great finds out there. Do not pay retail when Hotwire is around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: mickal343
Reviews.Content: If you are in downtown for clubbing then better choice is a hotel near gas lamp. We walked at least 10 minutes to get back to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: uglygolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Room clean and spacious. King bed extremely comfortable. Hotel was quiet. Balcony bar on 9th floor was an unexpected bonus. Daily happy hours around the firepits. Nice touch. Easy (3 block) walk to GasLamp area. Only negative was expensive valet parking ($32.00/ night) Helpful and friendly staff. Can recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: BannerotPartners
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to an Indigo, I understand that this particular property is the brand's flagship. Very attractive comtemporary decor, extremely comfortable amenities. Great bed and pillows. Large shower, closet and plenty of storage in the chest of drawers. Plenty of light also, in spite of energy-saving lighting. Nice flat screen TV but apparently no digital programming (picture on some channels was a bit blurry.) My room looked straight into Petco Field, too bad there wasn't a game ongoing. I like the elevator security; requires a room key to select a floor. The surrounding area was nice and it was a short walk to all the activity in the Gaslamp Quarter. Didn't notice any street noise even though I was on a relatively low floor. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room wasn't soundproof but hallway noise wasn't a distraction. Free internet makes you feel like you're not getting nickeled and dimed. I stayed 3 days and the place didn't feel stale at the end (as I have at some of the nearby hotels on previous trips.) I will certainly stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is not Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Disgusted454
Reviews.Content: I called specifically to ask if this hotel was "kid friendly". They said "yes". That is a joke. We arrived around 1PM. The kids were hungry. They do not serve lunch. They also have no kids menu for dinner. The reception desk was not friendly. We tried to send a fax 2 times. We found out they didn't send it at all. What service!!! No coffee in the room as advertised. Their excuse was "We are out of Coffee, nut you can come to the 1st floor and get some. Nothing for kids to do. Not even as much as a coloring book! The room service menu is a joke! They never did a complete job of cleaning the room. If this is how they treat Priority Club members, I would hate to see how others are treated. Oh yes, there is a valet charge of $32 a night. What a rip off. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Justretiredlovinit
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears quite new. Staff were quite friendly and helped us with directions and booking sightseeing tours. We used the in-lobby complimentary computer to book and print tickets for a hop-on, hop-off trolley tour. Our room was very large with a King bed and sitting area plus flat screen digital TV. Shower was large enough for 4 people but there was no tub. Very convenient location-3 blocks from Petco Field, home of the Padres, and 5 blocks from the gaslamp district where we found blocks of fine restaurants and bars with good quality food. The rooftop bar was trendy, relaxing and cozy, even on a December eveing. We dined in the lobby restuarant but would not do so again. The are is small, food was tasty, but the service slow and the menu items very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Newest, cleanest, modern, hip Hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: pb1914
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego for a business trip for a week. The staff is absolutely the best taking care of any needs you may have for your trip. The atmosphere is young but older people fit right in. It is very clean, and modern in decor. We didn't eat at the Bistro but the food did look wonderful. They had a trendy coffee machine in the room with different coffees and teas. Would have like just a regular type. We thought the 32 dollar a day automatic parking fee was pretty stiff and by the time you kept tipping the valet, it really got expensive. ALL IN ALL, IT IS A GREAT, NEW, MODERN PLACE TO STAY. Allowing the family pets in the rooms was quite unique also. It was nice to go to the 9th floor bistro and see family pets with their masters enjoying an evening on the ruff (I mean roof)

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel in great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: hhammill45
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Indigo a few months ago to celebrate a family event. There were about 10 of us in different rooms and all of us were really impressed with this hotels style, location, and friendly staff. The hotel and it's rooms have such a cool, sleek style to them. The design is really bold yet the furniture, beds, bathroom were all comfortable and highly functional. It is in a prime location as it is about a 5 minute walking distance to everything in the Gaslamp Quarter. None of us used our cars once. It was extremely relaxing and the staff was really very accomodating to all our questions. We hung out in the hotel bar quite a bit as it has a spectacular view of downtown San Diego and has fire pits and delicious drinks. We also had breakfast in the downstairs bar/restaurant. It was delicious. If you're looking to treat yourself to a top notch experience I highly recommend this hotel. I have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Luis043
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in New Year's Eve before switching to the Solamar Hotel(where we really wanted to go and had already made reservations). We had to pay full price ($200+) but came out with the feeling that it was worth every dollar we spent. The staff at Indigo were truly helpful and friendly, even though the hotel was packed and they were slightly overwhelmed. We asked for a quiet room at a high floor and got exactly that, with nice views of the Gaslamp district. The rooms are very modern and at the same time very functional. Extremely comfortable beds, very well designed bathroom, coffee machine in the room. Really there was little that we look for in a hotel that wasn't there. Moreover, the hotel just opened in July 09 so everything is brand new. One caveat: valet parking is very expensive at $30 plus (this is apparently customary in similar Gaslamp district hotels). If you will be using your car during the day it is very much worth leaving it in one of the numerous parkings of the district ($10 to $15 a night). Overall, 100% recommended

Reviews.Title: “Pristine hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: missprelude
Reviews.Content: We visited CA to go to the Rose Bowl from Ohio and started our trip in San Diego at the Hotel Indigo. Hands down the best hotel of the whole trip. Excellent, friendly staff, pristine lobby and rooms, the bed and sheets were to die for! Room is cozy yet modern. Good size room and bathroom with great glassed in shower. The price was excellent for what we got. I would recommend self parking (only one block away), otherwise, the hotel charges $32 per night for parking. Hotel room doors slam loud, but I wear earplugs so didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cshoffner
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time! We are so grateful to a young gentleman on staff there by the name of Dieter Schmitz. From the moment we walked in, he made us feel welcome and attended to without being overly intrusive or too nosy. He made wonderful restaurant recommendations and also gave us the low down on the local nightlife! The room was also amazing because of the marvelous view, luxurious bathroom, and cloud-like bed! We were sad we were only there for one night! We will definitely stay there any time we are in San Diego! We loved Dieter!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern Hotel with Fun Friendly Staff in Mardi Gras Like Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bmone
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean modern hotel with a helpful staff. Our room had nice views of the Padre's stadium (which is a block away), so I imagine it would be a good place to stay if you're coming into town to catch a game. We had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs and the food and service were great. The location is great as well, it's a two block walk to the main Gas Lamp strip which has lots of fun bars and decent restaurants and is pretty Mardi Gras-esque. Also, check out the rooftop bar, which has nice views especially at night, although the service was a little slow up there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Would go back.”
Reviews.Author: laplug
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms with hardwood floor. The bathroom was amazing with a spectacular shower. Liked the security feature that only allows you to access the floor you are staying on via elevatgor. The fact that the ice machines were located on the even numbered floors only was somewhat of a drag. A great deal if you are a member of AAA. The service was okay, depending on who you dealt with. Valet parking was $32/day, but that was to be expected. Overall, it was a great experience and highly recommend it. I would also highly recommend the Thai restaurant on the next block. Excellent service, reasonable prices and the food was simply divine. Danielle and Sylvie Nova Scotia, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: travelanne
Reviews.Content: Rooms were larger than a standard hotel room, large bathroom with a huge walk in shower. Too bad they didn't include 2 shower heads, there was definitely room for it. Service at the desk was nice and friendly, they gladly researched the local movie theaters for us (Thanks Joseph!) There are 2 computer off the lobby for guests to use, that was nice and handy. Valet parking is very expensive but we were able to find on street parking very close by. Beds were comfy with thick comforters and great large flat screen tv. Hotel is very new and modern. We stayed 3 nights post cruise. It's very close to everything downtown and great access to many, many restaurants and shops. The Horton center is nearby along with the hop-on hop-off trolly for a good tourist visit of the city. Orginally our dog was suppose to travel with us but she couldn't make it. I'm sorry she missed it because this place goes out of it's way for dogs. The hardwood floors in the rooms at first was a little cold on the feet but it sure makes the rooms clean. The hotel does have a very "cool" "hip" vibe to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dcjw700
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past weekend with our dog Buddy. This hotel is so pet friendly Buddy didn't want to leave. He was greeted by Dieter, Joseph, Chris and Sandie the hotel dog. Dieter gave him a water dish and Joseph mapquested pet friendly restaurants in the area for us. We walked Buddy two blocks to Petco Park...home of the Padres... to a lush, grassy park to play. Room was perfect for our needs with a great view of downtown. We will stay here again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: andrelb3
Reviews.Content: Had a greate suite overlooking the bar/fire pits. I travel a lot and have stayed at many hotels in San Diego. The ambiance, the room, and the employees were all great. Definitely one of the best hotels in downtown San Diego. The bar downstairs as well as the one on the 9th floor were very nice. Our room was beautiful. staff was great. not much more to say.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and inviting ambience”
Reviews.Author: bridgenut
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the trendy, warm and cosy lobby/reception area, to the minute we checked out, we could find no fault with this hotel. All the staff are extremely customer oriented and knowledgeable about tourist stuff and restaurants etc, with special kudos to Darren, the Scottish front-desk manager. Nicely furnished rooms, with comfortable beds, spacious spa-like bathroom with Aveda toiletries - plus coffee maker, iron and ironing board and free internet - added to the comfort level of our stay. Our room was on the 11th floor, with sweeping views over the city and the bay in the distance. While there, we attended the "canine cocktail" on Tuesday night at the 9th floor bar. Pooches and their owners enjoyed the outdoor area, with fire-pits and heaters and city views. They decorated the lobby/reception/bar area for Xmas and this added another pleasing dimension.......our five nights there went too fast! Thanks to all the staff who contributed to our pleasant, enjoyable stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Stylish, Comfortable....even though it was for work, felt like a spa.”
Reviews.Author: mudhonie
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the Holiday Inn family of hotels so I was pretty excited to try out their new concept hotel. It was fabulous. The rooms are gorgeous. Wood floors, uber-hip fabrics and textiles in the troom. I loved the Kuerig coffee maker and the Aveda bath products. The bed was super comfy and the whole hotel just had a fun vibe. The rooftop bar and fire pits are stunning. I would definitely stay here again. Plus it is only about 4 blocks over from the 5th street restaurants/bars.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, awesome value!”
Reviews.Author: Aussiefaith
Reviews.Content: A lovely, modern hotel. Clean, funky, right near the best bit of town. Finishes & decorare great, Staff very friendly. Awesome value!!!! The roof top bar is great. I can't recommend it enough -- we loved it here,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jaremela
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Indigo for 4 nights. The hotel is brand new so everything is well kept, clean and nicely decorated. The rooms are great...the bathroom is large with a lot of counter space, the beds are unbelievably comfortable and the views are fantastic. The gym is small but has treadmills, bikes and free weights...not to mention the view from the wall of windows! A separate meditation deck is off the gym...beautiful! For location, you can't find a better hotel. It's 3 blocks from all the restaurants and bars you could want and just a short cab ride away from attractions like the zoo, Balboa Park, Coronado Island, etc. The staff are amazing...especially the front door crew! I can't say enough about them, specifically James, Brian and Vince. They always had great suggestions for restaurants and for places to see. Any questions you have, go directly to them! For great restaurant selections go to both 5th and 6th streets...try the Strip Club which is a really cool 21+ steakhouse where you grill your own steaks or a good breakfast place just a couple of blocks south of the hotel is Broken Yolk...never thought sour cream on omelettes could taste so good! :)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely warm and comfortable with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: duguyisheng
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many upscale hotels around the world as well as 2 others in San Diego. We were visiting relatives and picked the Indigo based on other recommendations on this site. In short, we weren't disappointed. The price was reasonable and it was extremely inviting, comfortable and well run. Although we spent our time with relatives, it is within walking distance of great restaurants and activities including convention center, PETCO field. Parking is expensive but I think that is true of any downtown hotel (or it is reflected in the price). We had some difficulty signing in to the free wireless in room internet but a friendly phone call fixed that. We will definitely stay there again. This is my first recommendation on trip advisor but they deserve it so I am taking the time.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the total package.”
Reviews.Author: martinajm
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Diego. It's always stressful when you travel with your pet. Just because you travel with a dog you want a nice place. Hotel Indigo is a fairly new hotel in the area. I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel.. Pet friendly yes..No extra charges for fido. Pet Park very convenient. The whole staff shoud be commended for their excellent customer service. above and beyond all the time. The rooms are so nice and the beds are top of the line. Do you and your pet a favor the next time your in San Diego stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: xParzival
Reviews.Content: There's a trendy elegence to Hotel Indigo that understands the quality of everything the hotel provides. Beautiful room; sheets and pillows are heavenly. Bathroom had the ambiance of a spa and couldn't be better. Roof top open-air lounge? Beautifully done. Fitness center? Small, but never crowded -- and perfectly outfitted; great view too. Bar on the ground level is beautiful -- and since this is San Diego, the windows are opened accordian-style to united the space with the outdoors. Perfect. This was a business trip, so I didn't bring a pet -- but I could have! Hotel Indigo is unobtrusively pet-friendly (but I didn't know it without asking). What more can I say? Walking distance to restaurants & club as well as the convention center; and I had a GREAT view of the baseball stadium from my room. This was my first visit to wonderful San Diego, CA, and Hotel Indigo couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal for us”
Reviews.Author: acridrabbit
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel does not offer a fridge or microwave, which I wish I had realized before booking. We stayed there 4 nights, and we would have preferred to have at least a fridge in the room, but they didn't even have one they could bring up for us. Secondly, valet parking is your only option, and it's about $30 extra on top of the already pricey room. The room was nice enough, if a little cramped considering how much we were paying. The staff are typical of urban expensive hotel staff - a little snooty, but that is to be expected. Fancy lobby, and fancy, completely deserted rooftop lounge. The whole place kind of seemed like it was trying too hard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Surfingbulldog
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Hotel Indigo! Not only did my boyfriend and I enjoy ourselves, but our dog Dozer did too! You see, this is a pet friendly hotel and they give the same special treatment to your pet like they would to you. For example at the outside front of the hotel is a water bowl and doggie treats. How cool is that!....The staff made us feel very welcome. They were friendly and willing to hep us with anything! We stayed at the hotel for one night and the next day had our launch party there at the roof top bar. If you are considering having a special event or party, the roof top bar on the 9th floor is the place to have it. The view from up there is awesome and the ambiance is great! There are certain staff members we would like to give a special thanks to.....Vince from the valet service, Brian the bellman, Clare, Monica, and Thaddeus at the front desk, Joseph also from the front desk who wasn't there during our stay, but provided me with customer service over the phone, Brandon the bartender at the roof top bar, Kenney the server who helped us with tables, Marcello the Food and Beverage Director and Caryn and Milena from the Sales and Catering Department. These individuals went above and beyond customer service and really made our stay an enjoyable one! As we were leaving to go home, our dog Dozer put on his brakes at the front entrance, because he didn't want to go. I assured him that we are definitely coming back again and he was happy. We highly recommend this stylish and comfortable hotel to everyone! Thanks Hotel Indigo for all you do!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: bostonyes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a San Diego vacation that included six nights at this hotel. Everything was perfect. The room and amenities were modern and welcoming, and housekeeping kept everything spotless. No noise at night- we slept peacefully. We didn't rent a car, so the close trolley stop ("Park and Market" location) and great breakfast spot nearby (quick walk to "Cafe 222"- fantastic!) were more than welcome. At check-out the staff assisted us in hailing a cab. Also, we were without a computer, but the ones in the lobby area were complimentary and staff helped us print out tickets to events. Monica- one of the front desk employees- was always going above and beyond for us. Can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “An eco-friendly gem blocks from the Gas Lamp!”
Reviews.Author: mandas1
Reviews.Content: I only have one word for this hotel - PHENOMONAL! Ok, maybe I'll add a few more: amazing, beautiful, incredible, gorgeous, comfortable, pet-friendly, eco-friendly, attentive to detail, outstanding service! I tried out the brand new Hotel Indigo in San Diego over Halloween weekend for my annual "girls trip" with my friends from college. We all flew in from different cities, and one of my friends arrived several hours before me. I called the hotel and notified them that her flight would be getting in before me and asked if she would be allowed to check in - even though the reservation was in my name. The took all of her information and greeted her with open arms. When the rest of us arrived, we were greeted by name (how did they know it was us?) by saying "You must be the girls from Georgia and Wisconsin!" WOW! We got up to our room and it was beautiful! Rich full color, hardwood floors, large LCD plasma tv (not that we ever turned it on), and the best part of it all - Aveda bath products! (the same stuff I actually use at home!) While reading a little about the hotel in the in-room info, this hotel is the first LEED certified hotel for it's brand. They have so many great eco-friendly ammenities: recycling in the room, keep your sheets and towel program if you don't need them washed every day, hardwood floors for better air quality and many, many more things. They have a great 9th floor outdoor Phi Terrace bar where you can oversee San Diego harbor and the Gas Lamp district. It has a great environment embracing all of the elements of nature: fire with great fire pits, water with a beautiful reflecting pool, earth with incredible stone work and air with the open air terrace. They also have a wonderful restaurant and bar on the first floor that has large full-wall windows that open up - so you can experience the wonderful San Diego weather! Another thing that wins my heart over - they are pet-friendly! There were many, many people with dogs in the hotel and the dogs are welcomed just as if they are a member of the family. They have a canine cocktail hour with happy hour specials for the two-legged guests and free dog cookies and bowls of water for the four-legged guests! I've never seen such happy pooches! What can I say about the service? EVERY employee (or inbassadors as they are called) greeted us with warm 'welcome homes' every time we walked in, smiled, answered any questions we had, gave excellent recommendations of things to do in town and were genuine service providors! KUDOS to this team!! My favorite part of the entire trip would have to be Sandie - the Hotel Indigo mascot. She is a rescued dog from a local shelter who makes her home at Hotel Indigo. She greets the guests, likes to help check people in, and will do anything for a scratch! I will DEFINITELY be back to the Hotel Indigo San Diego! An amazing place in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great space. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: RoslynP
Reviews.Content: I loved the decor. This hotel has just the right amount of class and sophistication balanced with the perfect amount of comfort. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful, but special kudos go to the guys that worked the door/valet. The terrace on 9th floor is pretty cool, but I never saw a crowd. They mix a good drink, and the view is very nice, but you've got to bring the good times. The place is brand new. And while it's pet friendly, you'd never know it from the cleanliness. If I were going to stay in a San Diego hotel again, this would be it. Everything you need for entertainment and quick access to transportation options are all within walking distance, but the closest neighbors are quiet new construction condos.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort,style,fun and a professional staff at the front desk that started a fantastic weekend experience.”
Reviews.Author: crater55
Reviews.Content: I am a professional DMC from the Orange County area and went to Indigo to experience first hand what this new hotel has to offer to any future clients. I was not expecting much but from the start was totally surprise at the professional staff. The front desk staff of Darren and Dieter greeted me with all my questions answered before I even asked them. I was guided to my room along with a great tour of the hotel. The location is perfect for groups as they can walk to the Gaslamp district dining,shopping,and seaport all within blocks of Indigo. A must for anyone who seeks a weekend of not only fun in the sun but total package. The rooftop bar is great the food very good and again the staff is beyond your wildest expectations. I will make this a go-to venue and will recommend this to groups in the future as well as individuals who seek a venue sans any means of transportation other than ones own feet.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - How to delight a customer! Thanks Darren and Kimberly”
Reviews.Author: johnm2418
Reviews.Content: When my son's wedding was hitting a problem, Darren and Kimberly put the staff to work and delivered an outstanding experience. Between noon and 4 pm, they transformed the terrace into a great wedding setting for our small group and provided so much more on short notice. Not only have they gained a customer for life, I will always rave about them to others. Is there any advertising better than that? I would have rated the service higher but had to stop at the 5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: WiscBadgerfan
Reviews.Content: Hotel INDIGO was a wonderful place to stay in the Gaslamp and enjoy the last three games of the 2009 baseball season. It is very close to Petco Park and restaurants. It is also a short walk to the ferry to Coronado. The front desk provided good customer service by checking us in on Southwest Airlines while we were enjoying a baseball game on the evening before our departure. But they provided excellent customer service, especially Kelsey, by making sure that we recovered some of our belongings which we had left behind in our room after our weekend stay. Kelsey and all of the front desk staff were helpful, courteous, and professional throughout our stay and after.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chaba_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great area for people wanting to go to party. Close to all the bars and clubs. Staff is very friendly. Housekeeping needs some work. We had to call for them to clean our room. Very beautiful hotel. You can find cheaper parking in the area on the weekends, don't spend $35.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarryOnBag1
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Indigo and loved all of it. The staff was always friendly, from check in to check out. The rooms were modern but so comfortable. Loved the walk in shower. The lounge/bar on the 9th floor was a great place to hang out and get a view of the city and Petco Park. Every Tuesday the hotel has a doggy happy hour where owners can bring their dogs up to the 9th floor lounge to drink and mingle. The only negative thing I could say about the hotel was that there was quite a bit of noise from the streets at night. But you have to expect that with all the bars, restaurants and Petco stadium in the area. Thanks Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to a Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: raester13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two weeks ago for our honeymoon and it was Amazing! The pictures on their website do not do this place justice. it is soo modern and the decor is great. our room was absolutely perfect...5th floor and we had a view of Petco Park. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted even Horton Plaza. It was a perfect location for what we were doing on our honeymoon. this hotel is so new still and they seem to be keeping it up. the staff was very friendly. as far as parking goes, i think everyone should know when you are staying in a downtown area there is a parking fee. it should have been stated on your reservation. There is nowhere in downtown San Diego, Chicago, LA, or any other major city that you don't have to pay to park. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel near lots of restaurants and shops”
Reviews.Author: capelgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel only opened in July 09 and is beautifully decorated, fresh and clean. The roof terrace is fabulous overlooking the base ball stadium!. The staff were very helpful and knowledgable. We had pre booked and paid but didn't know that there would be an additional charge for parking. The desk manager accepted that we hadn't been told about parking and waived the fee.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: SunNFunLover125
Reviews.Content: It's hard to say where the best area to stay in San Diego is, but the Gaslamp Quarter was ok. The hotel is very nice, still smells new, and was chic, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was small, but certainly nicely furnished and big enough for a short stay. My room had a great view of Petco Park, but there was also a great rooftop deck with a small pool, firepits, and another great view of Petco Park. Besides the ballpark, there didn't seem to be much in the area, such as cabs, breakfast places, or restaurants, but most things were within a 15-minute walk of the hotel. I saw a lot of the city, including a number of rather seedy areas, and this hotel was in one of the better areas. The only thing keeping me from rating the hotel a 5 is its proximity to the water, restaurants, etc., but everything else about it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...Cant wait to go back and stay again !”
Reviews.Author: MrFoxBox
Reviews.Content: Wow..Holiday Inn's new style of hotel brand, the Hotel Indigo, is a hit in my book so far ! I checked into this property for a one night stay after working a few ball games at Petco Park. At first glance when you look into the ultra sheik lobby, its not just the visual experience, its an overall sensory experience...The colors for the eyes, the great music for the ears, and the scent of vanilla for the nose.. : ) The lobby has a bar, a restaurant, and internet access on great big screens, along with a printer very nearby...Loved it ! I checked in at about 5pm, and my room was ready to go...The front desk staff was awesome, its nice when they call you by name, and even better by first name like they did...After a great trip up the elevator to the top floor, floor 12, via the elevator that talks to you in a great accent, I arrived at my room. The room was simply awesome ! Best decorated room I have seen in a while, hardwood floors, awesome bathroom, with a great oversized shower that was very roomy...... The king sized bed was very comfortable, the TV reception was perfect, I cant remember if it had HD programming. The room had great views of the city and bay. On a side note, go check out the 9th floor Terrace, it was fireplaces, comfy chairs, TV's on the wall, speakers, and a bar with your favorite libations you can enjoy while enjoying the view that looks straight down into PETCO Park with an un-obstructed view of home plate, as the hotel is just a few blocks beyond centerfield and the Park at the Park. Upon leaving the hotel back to the airport I walked to Broadway and 4th Ave and caught a city bus (#992), that goes straight back to the terminals at the airport for like $ 2.256..save the cab fair and get some exercise... This place is extremly pet friendly..It seemed like some employees had their dogs with them... Cant wait to go back ! Holiday Inn got this one right !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: coso333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the boutique offering of the InterContinental brand (Holiday Inn, etc.). The building is new construction and seems fairly well built. Our room was directly next to a housekeeping storage room and two or three times over our two night stay, I could hear things being placed on shelves or moved around. I also heard people talking loudly in the hallway at night (only once or twice). These few noises are my only complaint about this property and the reason the "Room" only got a rating of 4/5. I really liked everything else. The lobby is large and is open to the restaurant. The corner walls open completely, lots of fresh air in. There aren't really bugs in San Diego so that is not a problem. The room was fairly spacious and had a laminate wood floor with a rug under the bed. The bed was comfortable and had decent linens. Bathroom was large and had a great shower with hand held showerhead. The window was huge and a part of it opened, letting fresh air in. When the window was closed, street noise was barely detectable. The 9th floor bar was fun and had a great view of Petco park and the neighborhood. It was nice to be able to put my feet up by the fire pit and sit with a drink. Drinks were not too expensive for a downtown hotel bar. I think it was $4 for a beer and about $6 for a mixed drink. The bartender was friendly and efficient. I had breakfast at the hotel twice. My favorite was the Crab cake Benedict. Delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Omni Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravFiend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Indigo this Labor Day Weekend, and overall, we were very pleased with this new hotel in downtown San Diego. We've previously stayed at the Omni Hotel, and both thought that Hotel Indigo was better. This hotel is located near the Petco Park, and away from the rowdy crowd so it's much quieter, but still close enough to everything else. The staff is extremely friendly and courteous. Decor contemporary, and since it is relatively new, everything was clean. Bed was extremely comfortable, though bed linens were a touch rougher than what we're used to. Valet parking was $32, so we opted for street parking, which wasn't bad since street parking on sundays and holidays are free. This hotel is apparently pet friendly, but we didn't get to bring our dogs since one of them gets car sick. For pictures of the hotel, fitness center, rooms, etc: http://thelittleyaris.blogspot.com/2009/09/hotel-indigo-san-diego.html

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: hellatrip
Reviews.Content: It's not huge, but not a true boutique (somebody told me its part of Starwood or something of that ilk), and that's not a bad thing: Pros: *Very central location in the gaslamp. (though you first need to decide if that gaslamp is where you want to stay - lots of nightlife, i.e. restos, bars, condos, Petco Park, etc. It's really cool, but not if upscale La Jolla is more your cup of tea. It was great for us as we were only in town for 3 nights). Pretty much everything you'll want/need is within, say, a 10 block area so easy walking. *new and very clean *great rooms, with good room and bath sizes (great shower, no tub). * cool bar in lobby and nice deck on 9th floor, great views of Petco Park (you could probably watch a ballgame from here) perfectly fine workout room (with a nice view of DT) *easy access to 5 and 75 if you're driving. (we drove in and out of SD and also did side trips to Coronado and La Jolla so that was important) Cons: *Lack of parking options. Hotel valet is is expensive at $32 per day, but lots are more expensive. You can park at meter on street 'til 8AM, but good luck finding one after about 7PM. Bonus tips: walk east one block to find Market 32 on the corner (I believe that's the name) for brekkie. It has fresh fruit, etc, some picnic style seating inside, and phenomonal smoothie - made with acai berry smoothy, granola, fresh fruit and honey. From there, walk up the street, i.e to the north end of the same condo development and you'll find Sbux.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: cortsie1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cute. It just opened but it already is getting a little bit dated and worn down, But beware!! if you you are going here for a nice quiet stay this is not the hotel. We experienced a very noisy room. We had tons of noise coming from both sides. I had to get up at 2am and change rooms. We were with friends and they chose to stick it out but i absolutely refused because neighbors were obscene!! I was charged 250.00 to sleep in a room for just five hours. In my new room i could still hear the neighbors, but i was so worn out i just toughed it out. If you are up for a cute fun place to stay and do not mind the noise this would would work out well. Great area and lots of places to hang out at. I'm sure there are better places to stay though for the buck

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Chic without being pretentious”
Reviews.Author: lbrooks2029
Reviews.Content: LOVED it! The hubby and I stayed there for the first night of Street Scene so that we could enjoy adult beverages. It was only a few blocks from the festivities and a few blocks from everything else downtown. We checked in and immediately noticed the beautiful decor: the "water-wall" feature, the bamboo plants, and the contemporary furnishings. The valets were friendly and helpful, without being stuffy. The gentleman at the desk, David, was chatty and made us feel comfortable. He answered our questions about the hotel and also told us about the 9th floor's bar and their happy hour specials. After checking in, we went up to our room and we were impressed with the beautiful furnishings. It felt contemporary and homey-or at least it felt like the furniture we would llove to see in our home! ;-) The color scheme was wonderful-We loved the hardwood floors and the cool lamps. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was functional, spacious, and well-decorated. Our view of downtown, from the fourth floor, was amazing. We watched the sunset and also had a view of Petco Park. After dropping off our luggage, we went upstairs to the bar. The bartender was helpful and made us some great happy hour specials! (His name was David, also.) The view was incredible from the 9th floor. The music wasn't too loud and we loved the fire pits on the patio. We had a great night in this hotel and we will happily stay there again. It was a great price on a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lapartier
Reviews.Content: This brand-new hotel is beautifully designed, with modern decor, including hardwood floors in the rooms, and eco-friendly touches throughout. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The best part is that it is one block from Petco Stadium and a few blocks away from the Gaslamp district so everything is walking distance. Very happy with Indigo!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation despite such a terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: CybeRise
Reviews.Content: You may enjoy this hotel if you are only here to party. If that's you then you will enjoy this place. I heard music and sirens all night since it is in a really bad part of the gaslamp quarter. It's on a outer rim of the quarter. Hotel decor is ok if you are into modern type hotels. No carpet, all hardwood floors. If you are facing south you get to stare at a Orwellian looking building to the left and part of petco park to the right. Also, they charge $32 for parking and since there is no street parking you have no choice. The good things about this place are that it really is centrally located. I was able to hang out in Coronado all day and also go to the pier at Harbor blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: rubinNewYork
Reviews.Content: Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Great location--within walking distance from many local restaurants. Rooms were both trendy and functional. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo is the perfect place to stay in San Diego whether you're visiting for business, or just want to get away.”
Reviews.Author: skmarx
Reviews.Content: I surprised my boyfriend with a night at the new Hotel Indigo and I didn't want to leave. Not only is it eco-friendly, dog friendly and right downtown San Diego, the customer service is great, the decor is fresh and modern, I could live in the comfortable beds and the view of PetCo Park is unreal. Plus the rates are super reasonable. I would highly recommend this new hotel to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: margieco
Reviews.Content: We didn't plan to go to San Diego during Comic Con, but that was the weekend we went. Hotels were impossible to find but Hotel Indigo had rooms available because they were newly opened. Great value, cute boutique hotel. Nice bathrooms (showers only, tho) and really comfy beds. Big rooms with great views of the ballpark. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Eco-friendly, chic hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JAGster501
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just spent the weekend at the Hotel Indigo. The service (Adriana and David at the Phi Bar on the Terrace and James at Valet were phenomenal), decor, ambiance and every aspect of this hotel was perfect. The hotel was entirely sold out this weekend due to Comic Con, however (quite amazingly), it remained intimate. We never had to wait in line, there were great people to socialize with when desired, but we had complete privacy as well. It was a very romantic place to stay. BONUS for sports fans (and the people that love them) - you can watch the Padres play from the Terrace Bar on the 9th floor (you can see home plate), while having outstanding drinks and fun snacks. We are already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful guest rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rascalsmomchicago_il
Reviews.Content: This hotel had just opened at the time of our stay. The guest rooms are beautiful and the bathroom large with an oversize shower. We had a fabulous view into Petco Park and the fireworks. But when you pull the drapes, they block out all of the outside light and there were no noise issues whatsoever. The terrace bar is a treat and the main lobby bar has a beautiful breeze blowing through day and night. The location is great - just four blocks to Fifth Avenue restaurants and bars as well as walking distance to the convention center. All of the technology amenities a business traveler seeks as well. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: This is an odd review to write. This hotel has only been open 6 days so anything I say could be premature. That being said, here I go with my opinions. 1. Staff is eager and energetic, yet somehow immature and unseasoned. 2. Rooms are different. Faux wood floors make for noisy atmosphere. Area rug covers small area near window. 3. 9th Floor Bar is lovely, as is the meditation deck and exercise areas, also on the 9th Floor. 4. I am a Priority Club GOLD member, but no upgrade or perks. 5. Valet parking is OUTRAGEOUS at $32 a day! Over the top. 6. "Easy chair" in room is a large wing back and among THE most uncomfortable ever. What's the point in that? 7. Nice big comfortable beds with upgraded bedding. 40" Flat Screen TV's. 8. Big "walk-in" shower with useless wooden stool and European hand-held shower. I took the stool out as I don't normally sit for my shower. 9. Upscale Aveda toiletries. Nice touch. 10. Oddly, with all the thought into the room design, there are few choices to place baggage. 11. Odd furnishings and decor, including naugahyde (sp?) foot stool and weird and unappealing wall paper/painting. 12. Interesting, limited and creative room service menu that may not appeal to all. Prices are decent, however, so we'll see what they deliver. In summation, a clean, new hotel property with little to recommend it above the more luxe area hotels (Omni & Marriott). Unless the rooms are very competitive and you can park off-site and avoid the excessive fee, I can't recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new boutique hotel across from Petco Park”
Reviews.Author: dinkopal
Reviews.Content: We got lucky and was overbooked at the Se San Diego so they sent us to Hotel Indigo. We loved it! From the valets to the desk staff, everyone was genuinely pleasant and friendly. We had expected the valet charge of $32 which was fine. Especially since we there when the Padres were playing plus there was a big street party down the street so the parking was pretty pricey everywhere. The internet was free which was nice. This is also a green hotel which is important to me. The room were in was on the ninth floor right next to the elevators and the bar. But our room was very quiet and comfortable. Loved the hardwood floors, big comfy bed, flat screen tv and attractive large bathroom. My husband loved the roomy glass shower that had a bamboo stool in it that you could just sit down and let the hot water from the shower relax you. There is a meditation room just outside of the fitness room that is relaxing although not very quiet as this is in downtown San Diego. The fitness room was well equipped. The outside bar on the ninth floor has a wonderful view of Petco park which is just over the next block. It was nice to have a drink outside and watch the game from afar while sitting next to a gas fire. The only setback is that this hotel does not have a swimming pool but they do have what they call a "reflection pool" in the bar area. You can't swim it but you can sit next to it and run your fingers in the cool water and reflect I guess. We really enjoyed our one night stay at Hotel Indigo on their 6th day of business! Special thanks to Kimberley and Darren at the front desk. They were very pleasant and helpful as were all the staff we encountered during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - be aware of extra cost”
Reviews.Author: SpongeBobCH
Reviews.Content: Brand new, excellent design, beautiful. We booked a black box 4* via Hotwire in the hostoric center (Gaslamp district) and got into this new hotel (4 days open) for 127USD + taxes. In general very friendly staff. Well sized rooms, etc. I am using the WIFI now (I think its free). They have a spectacular terrace on the 9th floor and you can see into the Ballpark of the San Diego Padres (and we just saw the fireworks). The fitness rooms seems to be above average as well (They even had complimentary power bars and fruits - remains to be seen if they keep this). Now a few smaller drawbacks. -The valet parking is 32+tax+tips. So if you are, like I am, not a big fan of valet parking you can park for 15 bucks one block away (plenty of parking around here). - I went to the bar and ordered a glass of wine to take it to the room. No prices on the bar list (pretty common, nevertheless I don't like it) so the glass turned out to cost 10 dollar + tax+tip. The real problem was that the glass was barely wet. The lady serving at the bar (very unfriendly) couldn't quite cope with the busy evening and she disappeared in a hurry so I couldn't complain. Well, I asked another staff and he told me they typically put 6oz - I got probably half of that (in a designer glass that looks like a shrunken whisky glass, big minus too). Might have been a honest mistake on a busy evening - still left me with a bad experience at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Brand spanking new and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Spjika
Reviews.Content: We happened to book a trip for a conference that coincided with opening day for the Indigo. As a result the service was exceptional and they were all quite giddy with excitement on the first day of full business. Great reception, helpful and prompt friendly staff. Rooms are beautiful, very chic, well appointed and obviously as this is a brand new hotel- very new and immaculate. Well laid out rooms, great bathrooms and roomy showers with good facilities. Gym is decent with great views. Most rooms seem to have top views too. The bar is on the rooftop and has an amazing view right into the Padre's stadium. Beds are comfy, good down pillows and the place is really slick overall. Very enjoyable.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Indigo San Diego Gaslamp Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 509 9th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101
